But Joe wasn't allowed to touch anything. His mom made sure he kept his hands to himself. Though he was a bit sad at first, he ended up having a great time just looking at everything in the lab. The rain was still pouring outside, so they stayed a while longer.

When they finally left, Joe and his mom headed home. Joe was happy to be back in the warmth and dryness of their house. He said goodbye to the wild rain and the fantastic lab, and looked forward to coming back some day.

Once upon a time, there was a little girl named Jane. She had long orange hair, bright blue eyes and she was always happy.

One day, Jane was outside in her garden and she noticed something, a big shadow! Jane was a bit scared, but she decided to find out what it was. She walked closer and saw that it was a big, clean bear!

The bear was a bit shy, so Jane decided to give it some food. She gave the bear some apples from her tree and the bear started to eat them. It tasted so good and the bear was happy. Jane was too.

The bear and Jane became friends and spent time together every day. Jane gave the bear something to eat and the bear gave Jane a big hug. They were the best of friends.

The end.

Once there was a fat boy who loved history. He would spend hours reading books and memorizing dates and events. 
One day, the fat boy had a great idea. He put on a costume and pretended to be a great historical character. He thanked everyone for all their attention.

But people didn't like him. They said his costume was silly and laughed at him. The fat boy was very sad. He stopped pretending and went home. 

The next day, the fat boy tried again. But the same happened. People laughed, and the fat boy got angry. He ran away and the people stopped laughing. 

The fat boy was so embarrassed and never thanked anyone again. He stayed with his books and never pretended again. That was his sad history.

Mama and Jack were in the yard playing. Mama said, "Let's create something together!"

Jack thought for a moment and then he said, "Let's make a log!"

Mama smiled and said, "That's a great idea, Jack! We can make it regular."

So, Mama and Jack got to work and they worked very hard. Together, they collected some sticks and stones and leaves and then stacked them up in a regular shape.

Mama smiled at Jack and said, "We made a log! We created it together." 

Jack laughed and said, "Let's make a regular log again tomorrow, Mama!"

Mama smiled and said, "Okay, let's make it a regular routine!"

Once upon a time there lived a little boy named Johnny. Johnny was three years old, and wore a blue and white striped shirt. One day, he was walking across the park with his mother.

Johnny was feeling very hungry, and asked his mother, "Mom, when can I have a snack?"

His mother smiled and said, "Let's first complete our task, then we will get you something to eat."

So they set off to do the task they had. After they had completed it, his mother said, "There, we have completed the task. Now, let's get you something to eat!"

Johnny happily ate the snack his mother had given him. He felt full and satisfied. He had completed his task, and was no longer hungry. 

Satisfied, Johnny and his mother continued to walk across the park.

Once there was a little girl named Monica. One day she was feeling bored, so she grabbed a pencil off the floor and started to draw.

Suddenly, her mother came into the room and said, "Monica, why are you ignoring me?" Monica looked up, feeling guilty. She said, "I'm sorry, mommy. I didn't mean to ignore you."

Her mother hugged her and said, "It's okay honey, but don't forget to listen to me next time." Monica nodded, feeling relieved. 

From then on, Monica would obediently listen whenever her mother spoke. She also started to put away her pencils when she was done drawing, to make sure she wouldn't forget to listen.

Once upon a time there was a little boy called Mark. Mark was only three years old and loved to play.

One day, Mark was outside looking for things to play with. He found a pot and decided to try and clean it. He found an oat and started scrubbing the pot.

But then his mother called him inside. He felt guilty, so he quickly put the oat down and went inside. 

"Mark, you've been outside for too long", said his mother. 

"But I was cleaning!" said Mark.

His mother smiled and said, "That's nice. But now it's time to come inside and have some lunch." 

Mark smiled and happily followed his mother inside. 

The end.

Once there were two volcanoes. They were very competitive and wanted to be the biggest. They spewed ash and smoke up into the sky. The ash was so dark that it blocked the sun from the towns below. Everyone was worried.

The bigger volcano made the situation worse. It became very angry and started to burn everything in sight. Trees and houses were becoming engulfed in flames. People ran and tried to get away from the fire.

Finally, the sun came out again. The bigger volcano was quiet now. Everyone was so relieved that the burning had stopped. They all came together to celebrate because they were now safe. 

The smaller volcano was also quiet and happy that the burning had stopped. But it was still competitive. It wanted to be the biggest volcano. So it started to spew more smoke and ash into the air. Everyone looked up at the volcano and cheered!

Tom was eager to go to the theater. He loved seeing the bright lights, colorful costumes, and loud music. 

His mom asked, â€œDo you want to go to the theater with me and dad?â€

Tom jumped up and down and shouted, â€œYes! Yes!â€

They drove to the theater and found their seats. There was an actor on stage doing a funny dance. Tom laughed, clapped, and cheered. Then the actor started to twist and turn in the craziest way. Tom's eyes lit up. He felt so excited and tried to twist too. 

He stood up and tried his best. He cheered and said, â€œLook at me! Look at me!â€

His mom laughed and said, â€œYouâ€™re getting so good!â€

Tom smiled. He was so eager to show off his new moves.

Once upon a time, there was a colorful cat. It was very fluffy and everyone loved it. The cat liked to explore and have adventures. One day, the cat wandered off and got lost in the woods. It meowed and meowed, but no one could hear it. 

Suddenly, the colorful cat heard someone calling out to it. It was a boy! He said he was lost too. The cat and the boy decided to work together to find their way out of the woods. They walked and walked, and soon they found the way home. 

The boy hugged the cat, telling it that it was very brave and clever. Together they had not lost. Everyone was so happy when the boy got home. He introduced the cat to his parents, and the cat was part of the family ever since.

It was Sunday morning and Jake was feeling very excited. He looked out the window and saw lots of furry animals playing in the garden. He couldn't wait to join them!

His mum and dad smiled at him and said, "Come on Jake, let's go outside!"

Jake carefully opened the front door, and he was amazed at how big and beautiful the garden was. There were so many furry animals! Rabbits, dogs, cats and even a few little birds. It was so adorable!

Jake wanted to cuddle all of them, but his mum and dad said, "No, Jake! Be gentle and don't touch the animals, okay?"

Jake nodded, and he just watched the animals happily playing together. He remained quiet and still, and watched the animals until they all went home.

When the last animal disappeared, Jake's mum and dad said, "Come on Jake, it's time to go inside now. You did well staying still and not touching the animals. That was very brave of you!"

Jake smiled and said, "But it was very adorable, wasn't it?"

His mum and dad smiled, and said, "Yes Jake, it sure was!"

Once, there was a thick animal. It lived in a forest full of trees and sunshine. One day, a little bird flew to the animal and whispered in its ear. The bird told the animal it had to leave the forest. The animal was sad, but it knew it had to go. 

So, the animal took one last look at all the beautiful trees and flowers and began to leave. It walked and walked until it came to a big lake. Here the animal stopped and looked around. The lake was so much bigger and thicker than the forest. 

The animal found a little boat, floating in the water. It climbed inside and floated away from the shore. The animal sailed away, across the big lake and never looked back. It was heading off on a new adventure and it was feeling brave and happy.

John was a three year old boy who lived in a small village with his mom and dad. He was a curious little boy who was always asking questions.

One day he asked, "What is love, mommy?"

His mom smiled and said, "Love is the root of all good things, John. It's something that holds us together and makes us feel safe and happy."

John nodded and asked, "But what if I'm feeling anxious?"

His mother hugged him and said, "That's okay too, John. When you're feeling anxious, just take some deep breaths and remember how much we all love and care for you."

And sure enough, when John felt anxious, he would take some deep breaths and remember his mom's words. He felt much happier knowing that his family loved and cared for him, no matter what.

One day, Sarah was looking for something fun to do. She decided she would dare herself to take a kayak out for a ride. She grabbed her life jacket, jumped in her kayak, and paddled away.

The open water shone like sparkles in the sun. Sarah was enjoying the ride, with the breeze in her face. But soon, something caught her eye in the water. It was a big green fish!

Sarah wanted to get closer to have a better look. She could see the fish's bright eyes and colorful scales. She was so excited that she had to get closer.

Sarah started paddling really fast, her arms working as hard as they could. Then, with one final push, she grabbed the edge of the fish's green tail.

The fish was surprised and leapt away, making a big splash. Sarah laughed so hard that she almost tipped out of her kayak. She loved her daring adventure and was happy she had such a fun day.

Once upon a time there was a young girl named Lily. Lily's mom gave her a new tank. But Lily was worried, she did not know how to take care of it. 

One day, Lily asked her mom how to take care of the tank. "You need to feed the fish, clean the tank and make sure the tank is always filled with water," her mom said. 

Lily followed her mom's instructions and soon the tank was in tip top shape. Every day, she was happy to watch the fish in the tank swim around. 

One day, Lily's mom asked her why she was so happy. She explained, "I was worried before, but now I know how to take care of the tank, so I am not worried anymore!" 

The moral of this story is never to worry, because with patience and determination you can overcome any challenge.

Once upon a time, there was a little girl. Her name was Clara. She was three years old. Clara was always happy and loved playing with her toys. 

One day, something special happened. Claraâ€™s doorbell started to ring. She ran to the front door and opened it. To her surprise, a big box of stuff was there. The box was pink and she felt so excited.

Clara opened the package. Inside, she found lots of different things. There were dolls and blocks and books too. Clara was so happy â€“ now she had even more stuff to play with! 

Clara played for hours with her new things. That night, before she went to bed, Clara thanked the kind person who had sent her the package of pink stuff. Clara smiled and climbed into bed, feeling very happy and grateful. 

The End!

Once there was a big elephant. He was having a great time playing in the river with his friends. But he was getting very wet.

So he decided to plan for the next day. He wanted to buy a large belt to keep him dry.

The next day the elephant went to the town and he found lots of belts. He saw so many belts but he wanted a special one. He wanted a large belt that would fit around him. 

Finally he found the perfect belt. It was large and strong and exactly what he wanted. 

He was so happy that he ran back to the river to show his friends. He showed them his belt and they all thought it was lovely.

Now, he never has to worry about getting wet. He can go play in the river every day and he knows his large belt will keep him dry.

Once upon a time there was a tiny ant. One hot day, she decided to march all the way to the beach. She wanted to go have some fun in the sand and cool off from the heat.

Along the way, she met a large elephant. He was very proud of himself and believed he was the most important creature in the world. But the ant kept marching on and was too humble to speak to him.

After a long march, the ant arrived at the beach. She was met with the soothing sound of the waves and the cool ocean breeze. She finally found the peace that the proud elephant had failed to find.

The ant learned a valuable lesson - it can take great strength to be humble. When the heat of life weighs you down, slow down, take a break and remember to stay humble.

Today, Joe was feeling very excited. His mom had promised him that they would go outside and play. Joe put on his jacket and ran excitedly to the front door.

"Wait, Joe," said his mom. "Where's your hat?"

"Oh, my hat," said Joe. He went back to his room and felt around under his bed. Then, he found it.

"Here it is," said Joe. He grabbed the cottony sheet and put it on his head.

"It's cold outside," warned Joe's mom.

The wind was indeed cold, and Joe quickly felt the bitter chill. But he was still too excited to care. He ran around outside, touching trees, rocks, and even the grass. 

Joe smiled and said, "I love touching everything!" 

His mom smiled back. "Me too," she said.

Once upon a time there were two ants whose names were Peter and Jane. Peter and Jane lived in a modern ant hill. Every day they played in the sunshine, gathering and storing food for their family.

One day, Peter and Jane were out picking food when their conversations turned to marriage. Peter said "I would like to marry you one day, Jane." Jane thought for a few moments and then blushed and said "Yes, I would like that too. But who will marry us?"

Just then, an ant from a neighbouring ant hill arrived to visit and he overheard them talking. "I can marry you both," he said. "I am the modern ant minister and I can do the job for you."

So Peter and Jane got married. They had a wonderful and merry wedding, full of fun, dancing and singing. Peter and Jane were very happy and all their ant friends were there to help celebrate. They had many years of joy and happiness together.

Once there was a little giraffe called Happy. He loved to stand on the top of the hill and watch the sun set. One day, he saw a strange operation going on down at the bottom of the hill. A group of animals were gathered around a grey box that was making loud noises.

Happy walked over to the animals to try and find out what was happening. One elephant told him they were trying to fix the box before it caused any harm.

"What could be so dangerous?" Happy asked in surprise.

"We don't know," the elephant said, "But the grey box is unpredictable and it could be harmful if we don't fix it quickly."

Happy didn't know what to do. He was worried about the grey box, but he also wanted to help the animals. After a few moments of thinking, he stood up and volunteered to help. He got to work helping the animals repair the box.

After a few hours of hard work, the box was fixed and the animals were relieved. It had been a harmless operation, and everyone was very thankful to Happy for his help.

Once upon a time there was an owner. He had a bright yellow duck. Every morning, the duck would wake before the sun came up. Every day the duck would wake and quack. The duck's wake up calls were always happy and loud. 

One morning, something strange happened. The duck did not wake up. The owner was sad and he tried to wake the duck. But the duck wouldn't move. The owner was worried and hugged the duck close. 

Suddenly, the duck opened its eyes. The owner was so glad that his yellow duck was okay. From then on, the owner made sure to always wake up a few minutes before the duck. That way he could make sure the duck was safe and sound. 

The End.

Once upon a time, a bear and a rabbit decided to test how strong their friendship was. They took a square rock and said that if they could break it, then their friendship was strong. 

The rabbit was sure that the friendship was strong, but the bear was worried. He knew the rock was so hard that it would take a lot of strength to break it. But the rabbit was brave and believed in the friendship. 

First, the rabbit tried to break the rock but it was too hard. Then the bear tried with all his might, but the rock was still too strong. 

The rabbit and the bear knew it was impossible to break the square rock. But then the rabbit had an idea. He said, "Even if we can't break it, our friendship is strong. Maybe that's even better!"

The bear smiled and agreed. From that day on, they knew that their friendship was really special â€“ they didn't need to break the rock to prove it! This teaches us that bad things can often turn out to be good things.

One day, Mommy had to go out to buy something. She told Tommy to wait for her at home.

Tommy was happy to stay home, but he was also a little bit scared. It was so gloomy out, and without Mommy, the house felt empty.

So, Tommy did something he hadn't ever done before: he decided to buy a cell phone. He wanted to have a way to call Mommy if he got scared.

He went to the store and found the perfect cell phone. He was so proud! He took it to the cashier, and with his pocket money, he bought it.

When Mommy came home, Tommy showed her the cell phone. Mommy was so surprised and proud. She told Tommy how smart he was for buying a cell phone.

Tommy was so happy to have the cell phone, and he was never afraid when Mommy was away again.

Once upon a time, there was a little boy who liked to play outside. His favourite game was catch! He had a little net and he liked to step in and out of it when he played his game.

In the backyard of his house, there was a little lake. He always wanted to play catch there but the lake was too big, he thought his net would never fit inside it.

One day, his parents told him that he could play in the lake if he wanted to. He was very excited and grabbed his net. But when he arrived, he couldn't believe his eyes: the net fit perfectly in the lake!

He played as if he never had before. He laughed and smiled, it was easy to catch the fish with his net. He was so happy and he thanked his parents for having found the perfect spot for him.

Once, there was a very rare animal. It had a long, bushy tail like a fox, but it wasn't a fox. It was very, very shy, and almost never let anyone see it. 

One day, a 3 year old girl went out for a walk in the woods. She saw the rare animal hiding behind a tree and said, "Hello, hello! Who are you?" 

"I'm a very rare animal," said the animal, "and I'm very shy. I'm not sure if I can show you my tail, but I am happy to share it with you if you promise to keep it a secret." 

The girl was so excited, she promised not to tell anyone. The rare animal showed her the beautiful scaly tail and they spent the rest of the day playing together.

The girl never forgot her secret friend. She went back to the woods every day looking for the rare animal, but she never found him again.

Once upon a time, there was a small girl called Lucy. She was three years old and loved to explore the world around her. 

One day, Lucy was walking through the forest. The sun was shining brightly and she could feel the warmth of its light on her face.

Suddenly, she heard something. â€˜Ahhh-Choo!â€™, it said. Lucy looked around and saw a little creature hiding behind a bush. The creature sneezed again, â€˜Ahhh-Choo!â€™

Lucy giggled and said, â€œBless you!â€ The little creature smiled back and revealed itself. It was a magical fairy!

The fairy thanked Lucy, â€œThank you, my dear. Now, I have a gift for you.â€ The fairy gave her a peaceful, shiny mirror. Lucy was so excited! She said her thank yous and ran away with the mirror.

The magical mirror was lovely, with a golden frame. Every time Lucy looked in the mirror, it sparkled with happiness. She always looked forward to playing with it and seeing the sparkles it brought her.

Lucy held onto the mirror tightly and walked away feeling peaceful and content.

Once upon a time, there lived a little girl. She loved to look up and see the big impressive rainbow in the sky. Every day, she imagined she was an eagle, flying through the colourful sky and reaching the top of the rainbow.

One day, when her mommy and daddy weren't looking, she found a way to try and touch the rainbow. She climbed a tall tree, squeezed tight and jumped. She flew through the air as if she was an eagle, reaching out to try and grab the rainbow.

But sadly, she couldn't grab the rainbow. Instead, she felt the gentle sprinkle of the rain, falling down, and the rainbow disappeared. But when she looked up, the rainbow was still there, shining brightly like before.

The little girl smiled - she had been so close to touching the impressive rainbow. She thanked the sky for the magical rainbow and said goodbye.

Once upon a time, there was a small girl named Jane. Jane was three years old and very brave. She wanted to find something special, so she set off on an adventure.

Jane walked through a dark forest when she spotted something shiny in the sky. She looked up as a sparkly shield floated down from the stars. Jane thought it was a magical shield, so she reached up to catch it.

Jane was excited when she held the shield in her hands. It sparkled in the sun and was full of original colours. Jane imagined the amazing things that could be done with this shield.

Suddenly, a voice called out, "hello Jane!" Jane looked around but couldn't see who it was.

The voice said, "I'm the Guardian of the Magical Shield. I have been waiting for someone brave enough to find my shield. Now that you have it, use it to protect yourself and others." Jane was very happy and thanked the Guardian.

She carefully placed the original shield around her shoulders and went off to explore the world. Jane knew that with the shield, she could find all the exciting new things she was looking for.

Jamie was 8 years old. He had a car that he liked to drive. One day his dad asked him to drive to the lawyer's house. Jamie was scared but he was excited too. When he arrived, the lawyer was very bossy. He gave Jamie lots of instructions and talked a lot. Jamie was worried he was doing something wrong. After a while, the lawyer said Jamie did a good job and could go home. Jamie was relieved and drove carefully back home. When he got there, he was so happy! He told his dad all about his drive. His dad said he did a great job and gave him a high five!

Jill was so excited to go to the parade. Her little brother, Steve, was too! They both loved to watch the happy music, colorful floats, and funny costumes. All day long they worked hard to get ready.

When they finally got to the parade, it was even better than Jill expected. Everybody was smiling and laughing. There were clowns and candy and drums and everything!

But then a rude person ruined the fun. He was loud and disrespectful, and he shouted at the people around him. Everyone was sad and angry.

Jill was feeling down but then Steve had an idea. He wanted to show the rude person that it was better to be kind. So he started clapping, and the other people followed. Everybody smiled again and the parade went on.

Steve's idea worked! He had turned a bad thing into a good thing. Now Jill and Steve knew that it was always better to be nice even when things were tough.

Billy was a busy bee. He liked to zoom around the garden. One day, he was zooming around and saw a big, clear package in the corner. He wanted to open it, so he ran over to it. But when he tried, the package wouldn't open! He started to feel frustrated and tried harder to open it. He tried pushing and pulling on it, but it still wouldn't open. 

He called his sister to come help. She came and tried too, but she couldn't open the package either. Then, Billy thought of an idea! He got some scissors and asked his sister to help him cut open the package. She agreed, and they cut all along the edges. Suddenly, the package opened, revealing a big surprise! Inside was a toy car and a remote. 

Billy was so happy that he and his sister could zoom the car around the garden together. They raced the car around, and they had so much fun. Billy was glad that he and his sister could open the big, clear package and find such a great surprise!

Once upon a time there was a sad man. He didn't like to do laundry. He was very sad.

One day, he was standing in the laundry room and he began to weep. His tears started to soak his shirt.

The man's little brother saw him and asked, "Why are you crying?"

The man replied, "I don't like to do laundry."

The little brother said, "Let me help."

The man was surprised. He wiped his tears, and he and his brother got to work sorting the laundry into piles. 

The little brother said, "Look! We finished the laundry! I bought you a new shirt and we even folded everything neatly."

The man smiled. He put on the new shirt and hugged his brother. 

The brother said, "You don't have to cry anymore. I will do the laundry with you."

The man was so thankful, and he knew that he didn't have to weep anymore.

Once there were two friends, Pete and Sam, who went for a walk in the park. As they walked, Pete noticed a friendly bee, so he decided to test it.

Pete said to Sam. "Let's see if the bee is friendly".

Sam was a bit scared, but he trusted Pete, so he agreed.

Pete slowly reached out his hand and said, "Hello bee, are you friendly?"

Much to Pete's surprise, the bee flew up and landed gently on his hand.

Sam was amazed, and said, "Wow, the bee really is friendly!"

Pete smiled and said, "See, I said it would be okay!"

They both laughed and continued on their walk, happy in the knowledge that the friendly bee had passed the test.

Becky saw a dog at the park. He was so cute and furry. She wanted to give him a big hug, but he was scared. He was helpless and alone. Becky felt sad for him. 

Becky asked her mom for help. Together, they wrapped the dog in a big blanket. He felt safe and cozy. He snuggled in close, and even licked Becky's hand. 

Becky was so happy that she could help. She was also happy that she had found a new friend. Now she and the dog could play together forever!

Once upon a time, a hippo was walking through the forest. He was feeling weird and didn't know why. Suddenly, he heard a voice calling him. He followed the voice and it lead him to a small lake. 

He was very curious so he peeped into the lake. He saw a giant creature sleeping at the bottom of the lake. He was so scared that he backed away and ran. 

He ran deeper into the forest and he heard the voice calling him again. He was so scared that he ran even faster. He didn't know why he was so scared but he followed the voice.  

The voice lead him to a cave. Feeling brave, he entered the cave. When he got inside, he realized that the creature he saw in the lake was also inside the cave. It jumped on him and licked his face. 

The hippo was relieved to find out that the creature was really friendly. He had been lead to the cave by his new friend! The hippo was no longer feeling weird. 

From then on, the hippo and the creature played together all the time and they were the best of friends.  They had a lot of fun because of the weird things that lead them to meet.

Once upon a time, there was an ice cube. The ice cube was mysterious, because it was always doing something interesting. One day, the ice cube wanted to play a game. 

It said, "Let's play a game. Can you guess what I'm going to do next?" 

The ice cube floated around the room and waited for the answer.

Then, a little girl walked into the room. She watched the ice cube and thought for a moment then she said, "I guess you are going to melt!" 

The ice cube smiled and said, "Yes! You guessed it!" 

The little girl was happy and the ice cube was happy too. They both enjoyed playing the mysterious guessing game.

Once upon a time, there was a little girl named Lucy who was 3 years old. She lived by a big wet building. One day, Lucy decided to explore the wet building. It looked kind of scary, but she was brave. 

When Lucy got to the building, she saw a big scary door. Then, she heard a noise coming from inside. It made her jump! 

â€œHello? Is anybody there?â€ Lucy said. 

Suddenly, the door opened and a big bad man appeared. He was very mean and he was making a lot of noise.

â€œWhat are you doing here?â€ The mean man said. 

Lucy was scared and didn't know what to say, so she just ran away. The man chased after her and wouldn't let her go. He disturbed her until she cried and screamed. 

The bad man was too strong for Lucy. He caught her and the bad story had a very bad ending.

Once there was a boy named Jake. Jake wanted to be a very competitive boy, but he had to test himself first. He needed to prove he had a strong spirit.

One day, Jake went to the park. He saw a big slide and he decided to test himself. He went up the stairs and he sat at the top. His heart was pounding with anticipation.

Jake pushed himself off the slide and he went very fast. But he kept going and he didnâ€™t stop. He felt his competitive spirit grow in him.

When he reached the bottom, Jake was happy. He had passed the test and he knew he was competitive. He gave a big cheer and ran off to find the next thing to test himself on.

One day, Sam and Lucy went for a walk. Sam brought his large toy seat and Lucy brought her small toy seat. They found a nice spot and sat down. 

"Look, I see a stitch in my seat!" said Sam.

"Oh no," said Lucy, "we need to fix it!" 

"Let's find a patch so it can be big and strong again," said Sam. 

The two kids went looking for a large patch to fix Sam's seat. After a long search, they found a patch to stick on the seat. 

"It looks perfect! The seat is stronger now," said Sam.

He and Lucy tested it together and it felt good and strong. They were very happy. 

"Let's go find more adventures," said Lucy. 

Sam agreed and they ran off together, with their two large toy seats.

John had been playing with his friends all day, but he was feeling hurt. He had mentioned to his friend, Tuesday, that he wanted to play a game with her, but she had ignored him. John was really sad and started to cry.

A kind lady noticed that John was upset and asked him what was wrong. John told her that Tuesday had not listened to him. He was really sad and didn't know what to do. 

The kind lady said that time would help make him feel better. She took John's hand and mentioned to him that it was Tuesday, the day of the week when anything can happen. "Maybe Tuesday will be a better day for you," she said. 

John felt a bit better and decided to go back and play with his friends. Sure enough, when he went back, Tuesday asked if he wanted to play a game with her. John smiled and said yes.

John was so happy that despite feeling hurt, Tuesday still wanted to be his friend. They had lots of fun together and never mentioned the hurt feelings again.

Once upon a time, there was a little boy named Sam. He was only three years old and he always loved to play. One day, he was poking around in the yard, looking for something interesting, when he found a present! It was wrapped up in a big, fit bow and Sam was very excited.

Sam ran into the house and showed his mom the present. She smiled and said, "Well, what do you think it is, Sam?"

Sam shook his head. He had no idea what was inside, so they decided to open it up together. Sam poked at the bow until it came apart and together, he and his mom opened the present.

As soon as they opened it, Sam squealed with joy - it was a bright red tricycle! It was perfect and fit Sam's size perfectly. 

Sam jumped up and down with delight and said, "Thank you Mom!"

His mom smiled and said, "You're welcome, Sam. I think you'll have lots of fun with it."

And he did â€“ until this day, Sam still loves to go outside and poke around the yard with his new tricycle.

One day, a little girl found a boat. It was a really pretty boat, with a glossy red paint. She wanted to have some fun, so she decided to sail in it. She waved goodbye to her mom and jumped on board.

The boat sailed out to sea. It was a bright, sunny day and the water sparkled all around the boat. Everywhere she looked, the girl could see colorful fish swimming in the water. The air was so fresh and the waves so lively, the girl felt happy and alive.

The boat sailed for many hours. Eventually, the little girl reached a small island. When she arrived, she saw a welcoming sign. It said, â€œWelcome to the Island of Happiness!â€ Everyone on the island was so friendly and full of life. It was such a lively place.

The girl had so much fun on the island. She played in the sun and she swam in the beautiful blue water. When it was time to return, she could hardly believe how quickly time had passed. She was so happy to have been on such a wonderful adventure. 

The little girl waved goodbye to the island and sailed back home. She was tired, but full of wonderful memories from her lively adventure.

Once upon a time there was a family that was very careful. On an especially careful day, they decided to go on an adventure. The family loaded up their luggage into the car and everyone settled in for the ride. 

When they reached their destination, the family unloaded their luggage and set off to explore. As they were walking, the 3 year old noticed something in the distance. 

The 3 year old excitedly said to the parents, "What is that?â€

The parents replied, â€œThat looks like a playground! Let's go check it out! Be careful though and make sure your luggage is secure.â€

So the family settled at the playground and had a wonderful time playing and exploring. When it was time to go, the family carefully loaded their luggage back in the car and went on their way. 

The end.

One day, there was a humble boy called Tim. He was only three years old and he was out playing in his garden. He was playing with his rake in the grass and making it look neat.

Suddenly, he heard a voice say "Hello Tim!" He looked up, and it was the kind lady next door, Mrs. Jones.

She said "Would you like a treat?" Tim nodded and said "Yes please!".

Mrs. Jones came over and said "Here you are. I baked you some cookies for being so humble". She handed him the plate of cookies and went home.

Tim thanked Mrs. Jones, then he went back to his rake. He grinned as he continued to rake the grass. He thought to himself, the kind Mrs. Jones is always so nice.

Once upon a time, there was a little girl named Lucy. She was three years old and had lots of friends. Every day, she would invite them to her house to play. One day, Lucy got a special gift. It was a cactus! She was so happy and jumped with joy. She quickly invited her friends over to show them her new plant.

When her friends arrived, they could not believe their eyes. They had never seen such a cactus before! The cactus had so many spines and looked very different. It was quite helpless without someone to care for it.

Lucy's friends were amazed. They were excited to help her care for her new cactus. They took turns giving it water and making sure it had enough sunlight. After a few weeks, the cactus started to bloom and everyone was so proud of it! 

Lucy and her friends were really happy that they could help out. It was a great reminder of the power of working together.

Joe had a fine carrot. He was happy to have it. He wanted to eat it. So, he chewed it and it tasted good.

He finished eating the carrot and so he wanted another one. He saw a carrot in the garden and he ran to get it. The carrot looked so fine. Joe was excited.

He picked up the carrot and brought it to his mouth. He started to chew it and it tasted even better than the first one. He chewed it until it was all gone.

Joe was very happy with his carrots. He felt full and content. He smiled and said to himself, "That was a delicious snack!"

Mommy and baby were walking in the park. Baby saw some ducks and was so excited. 

"Mommy, can we go closer to the ducks?" asked baby.

Mommy smiled, "Yes, of course. But we must stay safe".

They walked slowly closer, but the ducks didn't seem to mind. Baby was so happy, he could see the ducks very clearly.

Mommy said, "Look, sweetheart, the ducks are offering us a beautiful view".

Baby smiled and said, "I like this view. It's safe".

Mommy smiled. "Yes, it's safe. Let's enjoy this beautiful view together".

One day, a girl named Sarah was walking around her neighbourhood when she saw a luxury car. She wanted it to be hers, so she wished and wished and wished.

Suddenly, the car started to move on its own. Sarah raced after the car. After a few hours, the car stopped in front of an old house. The house looked so harsh and uninviting, but Sarah was too curious to back out.

Sarah knocked on the door and a strange lady appeared. She said to Sarah, "This car is yours now. Whenever you are sad, just drive in your luxury car and you will become happy!"

Sarah was confused and said, "But why would I be sad?" The strange lady smiled and said, "You'll know one day. Take the car and don't be sad anymore!"

So with a satisfied smile, Sarah became the proud owner of the luxury car and drove away.

Once upon a time, there was a smooth neck. A tiny bird flew around it, chirping and singing. Suddenly, the neck started to talk! "Oh bird! What are you doing?" the neck asked.

The bird replied, "I'm just singing a happy song!"

The neck thought for a moment. "I have an idea," it said. "Let's play a game. I'm going to move my neck up and down. When I'm up, you'll sing. When I'm down, you will be quiet. Ready? Up!"

The bird was excited. Up and down the neck went, and the bird sang along. It made a great game!

The neck laughed. "I'm having so much fun!" it said. "Let's keep playing!"

So the bird and the neck played for hours, until finally the bird said, "I'm tired! I need to go home now."

The neck replied, "Maybe we could do this again sometime!" 

The bird smiled and then flew away. Little did the bird know, but this was only the beginning of a beautiful friendship.

One day, Sam found a green point in the garden. He was very excited and he wanted to show it to his mum. He ran inside and said 'Mum! I found a point!' She smiled and said 'Let's have a look'. Sam pointed at the green point and said 'This is it!'

Mum looked at the point and said 'That's a very nice point'. Then she asked Sam 'What can we do with it?'. Sam thought for a moment and then said 'Let's play a game!'

Mum smiled and said 'What can we do with it?'. Sam pointed to the garden and said 'Let's hide it!'. They went outside and Sam hid the green point under the flower bed. Then he shouted 'It's gone!'.

Mum smiled and said 'Let's play a game. I will hide and you have to find the point'. They took turns hiding and finding the point until Sam found it in a tall tree. 'I see it!', he shouted.

They played with the green point until it was time to go home. Sam said goodbye to the point and took it back inside. He put it away in a safe place and smiled to himself. He would play with the point again soon.

Once there was a loyal dog named Spot. Spot lived with a family who loved him very much. Everyday, Spot wore a special sweater. Spot followed the family everywhere and always stayed close.

One day Spot heard shouting outside. He ran outside and saw a big cat. It was trying to fight with the family's pet bunny. Spot bravely ran in and started to bark. The cat was scared away and the bunny was safe.

Spot was very proud of himself. He looked very handsome in his special sweater. The family praised him for being so brave and loyal. Spot wagged his tail and knew he had saved the day.

Once upon a time, there were two brothers named Alex and Tim. They wanted to build something together but did not know what.

One day, Tim said to Alex, â€œLets build a castle! We can use the blocks to build it.â€

â€œCool!â€ exclaimed Alex.

The two started building the castle. They carefully placed blocks together to make four walls.

Then they had an idea â€“ they would make a tall tower with steps inside.

Alex and Tim worked hard to build the tall tower. When it was time to put the last leg on the tower, Alex accidentally bumped it. The tower fell over and all of the blocks got scattered about.

â€œOh no!â€ cried Alex.

Tim looked sadly at the fallen tower and said, â€œItâ€™s ok. We can fix it. We just have to be careful this time.â€

Alex and Tim worked together to rebuild the tower. This time, they were very careful. The two brothers cheers when the last leg was put on the tower.

Their tower was complete!

Once upon a time there was a bald man named Tom. Tom liked to stay at home and play with his toys. But one day, he decided to explore his neighborhood. 

As Tom was walking around, he spotted a lot of smoke in the sky. He approached it and saw it was coming from somebodyâ€™s house. Tom was scared and he wanted to stay away, so he ran back home. 

He told his mom all about the smoke. She was very worried. She knew that smoke meant a fire and she didnâ€™t want anyone to be in danger. 

So, they both rushed to the house and they asked the people who lived there if they were OK. The family were so happy and relieved to see them! They said, â€œThank you for staying with us! You truly are heroes!â€

Tom and his mom were glad they stayed to help. They felt proud of themselves and they found out a valuable lesson that day.

One day a little girl went to the park with her Mommy. They saw a hoop on the grass, and Mommy asked the little girl what she wanted to do with it. The little girl said she wanted to measure it. 

So, Mommy gave her a very long string, and the little girl started measuring the hoop. She counted to five, and the string was just the right length. Then she put the string around the hoop so it was in a circle. 

Mommy smiled and said "That was very original thinking, honey!" The little girl was happy that she had been so clever. She and Mommy kept measuring the hoop, and they had lots of fun. 

When they were done, the little girl was very proud of the hoop she had measured. She knew it was the most perfect hoop in the park!

Once upon a time there was a river that flowed through the land. Source of life, the river was special for all the creatures that called it home.

Each day, the sun would shine bright, and the river glittered like diamonds in the summer sky. But one day the sun shone so much that the river water became shallow. All the little fish, turtles and frogs that lived in it could no longer stay in it because their homes were freshly exposed!

The animals were very scared and did not know what to do. Thatâ€™s when they saw a big sea turtle, much bigger than any of them, walking on the riverâ€™s sandy bottom. The big turtle called out to them: â€œChildren, donâ€™t worry. Follow me in a row and I will show you the way to a deep part of the river.â€

The animals did as they were told and the big turtle lead them to a much deeper part of the river where they could all find shelter and safety. 

The moral of this story is that we should help others when they need our help, just like the big turtle did for the animals. We should never forget to shine our light onto others to help them along their journey.

John had a net. It was a lovely net. He liked to take it to the park. The park was full of birds and butterflies. He liked to try to capture them with his net. He would often have a lot of luck and managed to catch lots of animals. He liked to watch them before releasing them back into the wild. 

John was very careful to make sure that he didn't hurt any of the animals. He just wanted to have a closer look at them. He was always amazed at how beautiful and delicate they were. 

John's mum and dad always praised him for the way he looked after animals. They were so proud of how kind and gentle he was. They thought it was lovely to see him so passionate about nature

Once there was a little bird who wanted to soar like the other birds in the sky. But try as he did, he couldn't get off the ground. He was determined to soar, and he kept trying each day.

One morning the little bird was feeling very brave, so he decided to try one last time. He flapped his wings and jumped up, higher and higher than he ever had before. He felt dizzy as he went higher and higher until finally, he was soaring!

But when he looked down, he saw that he was soaring right over the bathroom! He got so scared and started to flap his wings in the hopes of getting away. But try as he might, he couldn't seem to fly away. He felt stuck in one spot, with all the people below pointing and laughing at him.

The little bird was so embarrassed, he wanted to take a dive and crash, but then he remembered how hard he tried to soar. So he mustered all his courage and managed to keep flying around for a while. He got away from the bathroom eventually and soared off into the sky.

The little bird was so proud of himself for overcoming the conflict and rising above it. He was flying high, and he finally felt like he was part of the sky.

Thomas and his mommy were walking to the park. They had been there many times before and Thomas was very excited. Mommy stopped and explained to Thomas that they were going to the park and he nodded his head. He knew it was a dependable place and was always full of friends to play with. 

When they arrived, Thomas saw all the slides, swings, and monkey bars he remembered from before. He ran to them and started playing. Mommy watched from a nearby bench and smiled. She saw that the park was dependable and he felt happy, safe, and cared for there. 

Thomas had a wonderful time playing with all the other children and made new friends. Mommy noticed his enthusiasm and went to join him. She explained that it was time to go, and Thomas was sad, but he slowly walked away from the park with his mommy. They both knew it was a dependable place for fun and laughter.

Once there was a little girl named Lucy. She was three years old, and she loved to explore. One day, Lucy and her mom went to the beach.

At the beach, they saw a big boat. Lucy wanted to go on the boat, but her mom said no. Lucy began to cry out of frustration. Her mom felt so bad and hugged her daughter.

The mom then had a thoughtful idea. She knew there was another boat in the harbour, so she suggested they go and show it to Lucy. After a few minutes of walking, the mom and Lucy reached the harbour.

The boat was amazing! It was much smaller and Lucy could explore it without her mom's help. She was so excited and thanked her mom for the thoughtful suggestion. Lucy thought it was the best day ever!

Molly was a little girl who loved to run in her red shoes. She often ran around in circles and made silly noises. One day, when Molly was running around, she stepped wrong and hurt her heel. She started to cry and screamed loudly. 

Molly's mommy came running and scooped her up in her arms. She found a bandage to wrap around Molly's heel and made her a promise that she would buy her new red shoes. 

Molly was happy and excited to get the new shoes. Each time she put them on her mommy made sure to remind her to be careful. Molly remembered the reminder and took care to prevent stepping wrong with her new shoes. 

From then, on Molly was careful while she ran around, always mindful of her heel. Even though she ran as fast as she could, she was careful not to hurt her heel again. 

The end.

Once upon a time there was a wealthy man. He had a big house and lots of toys. But he was not happy. Every day he would sit in his house and feel sad.

One day, he decided to go for a walk. He started to climb a hill. The sun was shining and the birds were singing. The man began to smile.

As he climbed higher and higher, he got to a special spot at the top of the hill. There he sat down and hummed a song. The more he sang, the happier he felt.

The wealthy man climbed down the hill with a big smile on his face. He had never felt so happy! He thanked the birds for their lovely song. From that day on, the wealthy man was much happier.

Once upon a time, there was a fat pet. His name was Mark. Every day, Mark enjoyed running around in the garden. 

One day, Mark was feeling particularly adventurous. He decided to explore further into the garden than usual. As he did so, he came across a tasty morsel of food. He quickly gobbled it up! 

Suddenly, Mark heard a voice. It belonged to an old man living in a nearby cottage. He said, "Hey Mark, why don't you come over for a visit?" 

Mark was a bit scared, so he ran away. But the old man called out to him, "It's okay! Come back! I promise I won't bite." 

This made Mark stop. He slowly walked back to the cottage and went inside. The old man had a lot of stories to tell, and soon Mark was smiling and having a great time. 

At the end of the day, the old man waved goodbye to Mark and said, "Come and visit me again, my fat pet!"

Once upon a time there was a lonely volcano. He lived up on a high hill in the middle of a vast, deserted valley. Every night, he would sit on the hilltop and look out into the dark, empty landscape.

The volcano felt terribly lonely and wanted some company. One night, he found a voice. It was arguing with itself. When the volcano asked who was talking, the voice replied that it was only a small bird.

The bird had been flying around all night looking for a place to rest. But the volcano made too much noise so the bird kept on flying. The volcano felt sorry for the bird and invited it to stay with him on the hilltop.

The bird accepted, and the two of them talked until the sun began to rise. The bird told the volcano stories of its travels and the volcano listened. Every night when the sun went down, the volcano and the bird would talk until morning came. 

Then one night, instead of talking, the bird started to complain about how cold and lonely it was up on the hilltop. The volcano felt terrible. He was so sorry to hear the bird complain and wanted to make things better. 

The volcano said to the bird that it could come and stay in the big hollow beneath his peak. The bird accepted, and from then on, the volcano and the bird were friends. The lonely volcano had a companion and was never alone again.

Once upon a time there was a little girl named Jenny who loved spending time outside. One day Jenny found a boat by the river and couldn't wait to explore. She said excitedly "I'm going in the boat."

As she jumped inside and grabbed the oars, her dad said, "Be careful Jenny, and enjoy your journey!" 

Jenny began to row and soon the river started to move with her. She felt the breeze on her face and the sun on her skin. She was so excited that she rowed until the river seemed to be standing still.

Suddenly Jenny heard an owl call out. It was so lazy and relaxing, just like the boat, that Jenny stopped rowing and lay down in the boat. The river moved slowly and Jenny watched the clouds and the birds flying above. She felt so happy and content. As she lay there, she enjoyed the calmness, like she was in a dream.

At sunset, Jenny's dad found her still lying in the boat, smiling away. He said, "Have you enjoyed your journey? Come on, little one, let's go home now." 

Jenny nodded, feeling tired but happy. She smiled as the boat slowly moved back towards the shore.

John loved to play in the pond. Every day he splashed around, feeling the cool water and smiling at all the fish he could see. John saw the shadow of a big bird fly past and he knew something special was about to happen.

He started to swim deeper into the pond and when he looked up, he saw a dragon! John was so scared he forgot how to swim and he started to sink. The dragon came closer and closer and John was too scared to move.

The dragon took one last deep breath and breathed fire over John. He screamed, but it was too late. Everything went dark and the dragon flew away.

The other children had seen what had happened and they were all in shock. Nothing like this had ever happened before, it was definitely not normal. The pond was quiet and dark now and nobody felt like splashing around anymore.

Once upon a time, there was a little girl who loved hunting for treasures in the woods. One day she found a shiny copper coin and was so excited! She couldnâ€™t wait to show it to her mother.

At supper that night, the little girl showed her mother the copper coin. â€œLook what I found!â€ she said.

Her mother smiled. â€œThatâ€™s lovely! Are you sure you donâ€™t want to keep it?â€

The little girl thought for a moment. â€œNo, I will return it to where I found it.â€

The next morning the little girl put the coin back in the woods. As she picked it up she noticed a spicy smell, like cooking food.

Suddenly, a voice called out from a nearby bush. â€œThank you for returning my coin! You are a kind and honest person.â€

The little girl was surprised. Who was talking to her?

As she stepped closer to the bush, she noticed a creature with big eyes and furry ears. He held a spoonful of spicy soup and said, â€œHere, this is a small thank you for returning my coin.â€

The moral of the story is that being kind and honest is always rewarded in the end.

Molly was very excited about the new rubber. It was pink and delightful. She could not wait to explore it.

She ran to the garden with her rubber. She was determined to improve her hopscotch game. She drew a line in the grass and laid out the rubber pieces in a row. With each piece Molly hopped further. She was so excited to see how far she could go.

When it was time for snack, Molly decided to try something new - delicious grapes. She had never eaten grapes before, but this time she decided to give them a taste. The grapes were so juicy and sweet. Molly loved them and asked for more. 

Molly was very proud of herself; she had improved her hopscotch game and tried something new that day. She felt very fulfilled.

Once there was a little girl. She was so glad to see her new toy. It was a bright pink top that she could spin. She tried to spin it as fast as she could. She was so happy.

But then, the top spun off the table and it broke. She was sad and no longer glad. Her toy was all broken and she could not spin it anymore.

The little girl was so sad that she started to cry. She could not believe that her toy was gone and that she could no longer spin it. 

The little girl tried to fix her toy. But no matter what she did, it stayed broken. She was so sad that she never wanted to try spinning again.

John was a curious boy. He had a guitar and he spent a lot of time rubbing it. One day, John wanted to take his guitar outside to show it off, but his mom said no. He was very sad, but still curious.

John's Dad had an idea. He said if John polished the guitar, it might make it look nicer. John liked the idea and started rubbing it with a soft cloth. He rubbed and rubbed until the guitar shined.

When he was done, his Dad asked him to play his guitar. John was so excited! He started strumming and soon the whole house was filled with music. Everyone was smiling.

John was so happy and he knew his guitar looked nice too. He was curious to see what other people thought of it. So he took it to the park to show it off. Everyone was amazed by John's guitar and he was so proud. The whole day, they admired it and asked questions.

John realized that sometimes, things don't work out the way you expect them to. But if you are curious and work hard, then you can make something beautiful.

Once there was a big birdcage. Inside the birdcage was a little bird. He wanted to fly, but he couldn't since the birdcage was too big. So he decided to look for a way out.

The little bird tried to use his beak to peck through the bars, but it didn't work. Then he tried to use his wings to pull the bars apart, but they were too strong.

The bird thought and thought, until he finally came up with an idea. He got some tiny pieces of string and tied them together. Then he used them to try and open the door of the birdcage.

Finally, the door opened and the little bird was able to fly away. He was so happy! He had defeated the big birdcage and was now free.

Once upon a time, there was a curious little girl named Anna. She loved exploring and learning about the world around her.

One day, Anna was playing with her marbles when she heard a noise coming from the garden. Curious, she went outside to take a peek.

To her surprise, she saw a little animal! It was a squirrel looking right at her and she was not sure what it was. Anna wanted to know more so she asked it "Who are you?". 

The squirrel looked at her and replied "I am a squirrel and I live in the garden". Anna was excited to learn something new and asked another question, "What is your name?".

The squirrel replied, "My name is Daisy. Would you like to play with me and my marbles?". Anna smiled and said "Yes!", so they spent the day having fun playing with the marbles.

In the end, Anna was happy to have a new friend. She learned a lot from Daisy, and will always remember her curious adventure in the garden.

Once upon a time, there were two friends called Sam and Jane. Sam was three years old and Jane was six years old. Sam and Jane enjoyed playing together in the garden. One day, they were playing and they noticed that nearby was a witch.

The witch was very messy, wearing many different coloured scarfs and had a pointed hat. Sam and Jane were a bit scared but the witch said, â€œDonâ€™t worry! I promise that I will not do any magic on you!â€

The witch smiled and waved goodbye as she flew away. Sam and Jane hugged each other and ran back inside. They were very happy that the witch had kept her promise! From then on, Sam and Jane always looked for the witch in the garden.

Once upon a time, there was a girl named Kate. Kate was very healthy and liked to go for long rides in her mom's automobile. She was so excited to get in the car and put her seatbelt on so she could go on an adventure. Every time she went for a ride, she liked to name the car, and each name was something silly and fun. Today she named the automobile "Turbo Speed Racer". She had the best time in her mom's car and loved feeling the wind in her hair. When the ride was over, Kate was happy and felt so healthy. She couldn't wait to go for another ride in her turbo speed racer soon!

Once upon a time, there was a little bird called Chirpy. Chirpy loved to whistle happily. One day Chirpy was flying through the forest when he noticed a bright red jacket on the ground. He stopped to take a closer look. 

Chirpy admired the jacket, it was so impressive! He wanted to try it on so he hopped up onto the jacket and began to whistle a happy tune. As he danced around, he heard a voice:

"What a wonderful coat you have! I wish I had a coat like yours!" said a little mouse standing nearby.

Chirpy was so surprised he stopped whistling. The little mouse had nothing to wear.

The moral of the story is that it is important to be grateful for what you have. We should never compare ourselves with others, as we never truly know what they are experiencing.

Once upon a time, there was a little girl named Kim. One day, Kim was very bored and wanted to talk to someone. However, everyone was busy and did not have time to talk.

Kim then spotted a knife on the ground. She was curious so she picked it up and asked the knife, "Hi Knife! Do you want to talk to me?"

The knife was silent and didn't answer her. Kim was feeling very sad and lonely. She started to cry and said, "It's so boring talking to myself."

Suddenly, the knife spoke up and said, "Don't cry Kim. I'm here to talk to you!" Kim was very surprised and excited to hear the knife talk.

Kim and the knife were the best of friends and she wasn't bored anymore. From then on, Kim and the knife talked to each other all the time.

Once upon a time, there was a boy and a girl. They loved to play together outside. One day, the girl wanted to go and play hide and seek. 

The boy said, â€œLetâ€™s play. But put on your sunglasses first!â€

The girl was careless, so she said, â€œNo, I donâ€™t need them. Iâ€™ll be fine without them.â€ 

The boy said, â€œI hope you will be careful. Sunglasses help protect your eyes.â€ 

The girl said, â€œOkay, I will put them on.â€ 

So, the boy and girl went outside to play. They were having lots of fun. But, one time the girl wasnâ€™t being very careful and she almost got hurt. 

The boy said, â€œI told you to put on your sunglasses. They would have helped you stay safe.â€ 

The girl said, â€œYou are right! From now on, I will be more careful and put on my sunglasses.â€ 

The moral of this story is to be careful and always wear your sunglasses when playing outside. Hope your eyes stay safe!

Mama had a big surprise for Baby. She put a big bubble in the middle of the floor and said â€œNow, Baby, crawl through this bubble!â€ Baby was excited and got on her hands and knees, pushing the bubble with her nose. She crawled inside the bubble and felt it bouncing against her. Suddenly, it popped and Baby was surrounded by bubbles.

Baby thought the bubbles were so much fun. She reached over to grab one, but it popped right in her hand. Baby got a bit sad, but noticed something disgusting on the floor. It was a big, slimy slug! She screamed.

Mama said, â€œDon't worry, Baby - it's just a slug. See, it's crawling away now.â€ Baby looked up and sure enough, the slimy slug was slowly sliding away. Baby smiled and decided to forget the nasty creature. She turned back to the bubbles and happily jumped in the middle of them.

Once upon a time, there was a little girl named Mary. Mary loved to march. Every day she marched around the playground, and sang happy songs. One day, Mary laughed too loudly, and made a lot of noise.

A grumpy old man heard the noise and became very angry. He shouted at Mary to stop, but she just laughed harder. The angry old man marched up to Mary and told her to be quiet. Mary was scared and stopped laughing.

The old man continued to march around Mary, getting closer and closer. He said nasty things to her and made her feel hurt. Finally, he got so close that he pushed her over. Mary cried and ran away.

The moral of the story is that it is important to be respectful of others, no matter how different they are. Everyone has a right to laugh and be happy, but always with respect and kindness.

Once upon a time, there was a little boy called John who had a bedroom of his own. It was always so calm in his bedroom and he loved to play when he was in there. 

One day, John was playing with his toys when he noticed a piece of rope on the ground. He was so curious and he decided to pick it up. He started to twist it around his hands, pretending it was a snake. He said, "Hissssss!".

Suddenly, he heard a loud laugh and he looked up to see his mom leaning against the bedroom door, watching him. She said, "You look like you're having so much fun with that rope!" John beamed and said "Yeah, it's so much fun!" 

John's mom came over and knelt down next to him. She picked up the rope and showed John how to twist it even tighter. Then she said, "It's time for dinner - why don't you put the rope away for now and let's go downstairs?" 

John put the rope away, feeling so excited to show his dad what he had learnt. Together, he and his mom went downstairs with a calm smile on both their faces.

Once upon a time, there was a sweet little girl. She ran around her house and laughed in the sun. One day, she saw something special. She saw a big, yummy cake! It was gray with lots of sprinkles and decorations.

The little girl smiled and said, "Oh wow! Cake! I want to eat it."

But then, she heard a loud scream. It was coming from her mommy. Her mommy said, "No! Don't touch the cake!"

The little girl was scared. She started to cry. But then she heard her mommy's voice again. "It's okay sweetheart. You can have the cake after dinner."

The little girl was so happy. She hugged her mommy and laughed. And when dinner was done, she had a very big slice of the gray cake. It was the yummiest cake she ever ate!

Once upon a time, there was a little girl called Penny. Penny was three years old and she was always very curious. Today, she decided to explore in her mum's room. 

Penny found a piece of paper and it looked very fascinating to her. She carefully picked it up and wanted to fit it in her tiny pocket. But it was too big and it wouldn't fit.

Penny started to get sad and she said "I want to keep it! Its very tasty!" Her Mum heard her and came into the room. She said "Its alright, Penny. You can keep it!"

Penny was so excited and she thanked her Mum. With the help of her Mum, she managed to fold the paper and it fit nicely into her pocket. She happily skipped out of the room, still holding her piece of tasty paper.

Once upon a time, there was a wet dog. He was very dirty, and he was all alone. He was so sad and he didn't know what to do.

Then one day, a nice lady came and saw the wet, dirty dog. She said to him "You need a bath, don't you?". The dog nodded and followed the lady.

The nice lady brought the dog to her house, and showed him two big buckets. One was filled with wet water and the other was empty. She said "Jump in the wet water and I will help you to wash and be clean". The happy dog jumped in the water and the lady started to serve him. She washed him with the wet water, and after that, the poor dog was all clean and dry.

The wet, dirty dog was now happy and clean. The nice lady had served him and made him better. They both smiled as the lady's kindness had made the dog happy. And they both lived happily ever after.

Once upon a time there was a brave cat called Lucy. She had the most beautiful fur.

Every day Lucy's owner gave her some food to eat. Lucy loved her food and licked her lips in delight.

One day, Lucy saw a shock outside in the garden and she wanted to explore it. She was the bravest cat around; so she thought nothing of walking up to the shock.

But as she got closer, she saw a huge noisy machine. She jumped back and was so scared, her tail was shaking!

But then she heard a voice calling out. "Don't be afraid Lucy. It's ok, I'm here to feed you."

It was Lucy's owner and he was smiling. He reached out and stroked her head and told her to be brave.

He fed her until she was full and gave her a hug. Then he said,"Come on Lucy, let's go home."

And so Lucy and her owner went home, safe and sound. Lucy the brave cat knew that if she was ever in danger, her owner would always be there to protect her. 

The end.

Once upon a time there was a powerful man named Bob. He had a special pass that was very important. He kept it in a safe place and didn't tell anyone about it.

One day, Bob met a small child who said he wanted to help. Bob didn't know what to do, but he trusted the little one. So he gave the pass to the child. 

The little boy thanked Bob and ran off. Bob watched him go, feeling very worried about his pass. 

The next day, the little boy came back with the pass. Amazingly, he had kept it safe! Bob was so glad. He thanked the little boy and knew he had made the right decision to trust him.

Once there was a little boy. He liked to study. Every day he would study something new. One day he found a strange thing. He picked it up and studied it closely. He was very curious about what it was. He kept studying the thing until he finally figured out what it was. He was so grateful! He had never seen anything like it before. He thanked God for showing him this new, strange thing. From then on he continued to study new things every day. He was so excited to try and learn something new and he was always very grateful for the knowledge he gained.

One morning, Jenny got up and went outside to the garden. She found a pretty rock and picked it up. She said to herself, "I'm not going to forget this pretty rock."

She brought it with her back inside and put it on a shelf. Later in the day, Jenny was busy playing with her toys. Then suddenly she remembered the rock. She asked her mom, "Mommy, did I forget something today?"

Mommy looked at her carefully and said, "No, I don't think so. What did you think you forgot?"

Jenny said, "I found a pretty rock this morning but I don't remember where I put it!"

Mommy smiled and said, "Oh, the rock. I put it on the shelf for you. You can go get it anytime you want."

Jenny smiled and ran off to get the rock. She looked at it and said, "Thanks, Mommy! I won't forget this pretty rock again!"

Once upon a time there were two friends, Sally and Daisy. They were both very organized and liked to keep their things neat and tidy. 

One day, Sally found a round ice cube in her garden. She wanted to keep it so she set off to find Daisy to show her. 

But when Sally arrived, Daisy was not happy. She said it was not organized, and that Sally had to put the round ice cube back in the garden. Sally did not want to, so she put the ice cube in her pocket and ran away.

Sally kept the round ice cube hidden for a few days until one sunny day when the ice cube started to melt. The round ice cube became a big, wet mess in Sally's pocket. 

Sally was sad, but Daisy said she could help. She got a bucket to put the melted ice cube in, and they put it back in the garden together.

At the end, Sally and Daisy were still friends and the garden was organized again.

Once upon a time, there was a number. It was very big and it kept growing. It spread fast and pretty soon it was everywhere. Everyone wanted to know what the number was. Finally, one brave person asked, and the answer came back - it was the number of friends! Everyone was so happy when they heard the answer, and they all shared lots of hugs and smiles. And from then on, the number grew bigger and bigger, spreading fast from one person to another, making lots of happy friends along the way.

Once upon a time, there was a 3 year old boy. He went to a big dark room with a lot of chairs. Everybody had an exam, and the boy was scared.

The teacher said, "Now it's exam time!" All of the children began to serve the exams. But the 3 year old boy didn't know what to do. He started to cry, and he was very scared. 

The teacher said, "You have to serve this exam, just like all of the other children." The 3 year old boy was so scared that he couldn't serve the exam. 

The teacher said, "Well, I'm sorry. You can't stay in this exam if you can't complete it." So the 3 year old boy went home with a sad feeling in his heart. He had failed the dark and scary exam.

Once upon a time, there was a bright duck who liked to zoom around the pond. He made lots of friends when he zoomed around, and everyone in the pond was happy. 
But then one day a big bird came and tried to take the duck away. The duck tried to zoom away but the big bird was too fast. He tried but he couldnâ€™t escape. 
The duck was very scared but he didnâ€™t give up. He tried to think of a plan, but it was too late. The big bird grabbed him with its claws and flew away. 
The other animals in the pond were sad. They missed the bright duck and wished he had been able to zoom away. The bright duck was never seen again. 
The end.

Once upon a time, there was a fat horse. He wanted to play with his friends, but his friends said he was too fat. He felt very sad and wished he could be thin like his friends. 

One day he saw a magical bottle and he picked it up. When he opened it up, water sprayed out of it. He thought it was so fun, he sprayed the water all over himself. 

Suddenly, he was thin! All of his friends were amazed at how thin the fat horse had become. But then, the magical bottle started to spray again, and the fat horse became fat once more! 

The other horses laughed and teased the fat horse, but he was determined to keep his thin figure. So every day he picked up that magical bottle and sprayed himself with the magical water,until he was thin again.

Once there was a little girl who was excited to go to the beach. As she ran onto the sand, she looked out and admired the sparkling blue sea. She saw a big boat on the horizon and she was amazed. She clapped her hands together and smiled with glee. 

The little girl spotted a lady walking along the beach. The lady was carrying a big basket and the little girl wondered what was inside. She skipped up to the lady and asked if she could take a peek. 

The lady grinned and said yes, so the little girl peered inside to find lots of beautiful shells. The lady said each one was unique and special, just like a person's heart. The little girl felt special too and was excited to find the special shell of her own. She looked around and admired the different shells until she found one with a pretty pattern. The little girl hugged it close and said thank you to the lady.

The little girl was excited to have her special shell. As she walked home along the beach, she kept admiring and admiring her precious shell and feeling the specialness in her heart.

Once upon a time, there was a gray bird who loved to sing. Every morning, the bird twittered and sang the happiest songs that it could find. 
One day, the bird flew over a lady's garden and saw something very special- a ripe avocado! The bird swooped down and grabbed the avocado in it's beak. 
The bird decided to fly high into the sky and find a nice spot to enjoy its snack. As it flew higher and higher, the bird sang a happy song while munching on its prize. 
The bird continued to sing even after the avocado was gone, until finally the sun began to set and the bird flew home. 
The end.

Once upon a time, there was a tough butterfly that lived in the garden. Every day, the butterfly would fly around and explore. But one day, the butterfly came across something it didn't understand.

It saw a big tall branch, covered in what looked like little hiding places. It was so curious, the butterfly decided to investigate.

When the butterfly looked closer, it realised the little hiding places were full of seed! But the butterfly couldn't reach the seed. No matter how hard it tried, it just couldn't get to the top of the branch.

Suddenly, it heard something, a deep and gentle voice. "Little butterfly, why don't you rest for a moment?" the voice said.

The butterfly looked around and discovered that the voice had come from a kind little bird.

The bird smiled and said "If you let me serve you, little butterfly, I could help you get the seed."

The butterfly thought long and hard, and decided to trust the bird. The bird served the butterfly by pushing her up toward the top of the branch.

The butterfly was so happy - she was able to get the seed. She thanked the bird for serving her, and promised to do the same if the bird ever needed help.

This story has a moral value - if you are in need, don't be afraid to ask for help. Sometimes, helping others can be more rewarding than it seems at

John woke up and opened his eyes. He looked around his bedroom. John's bedroom had a big bed and a toy sack on the floor. He grabbed the sack and opened it. Inside he found lots of fun toys. He was excited!

John was about to play when he heard someone knocking at the door. It was his grandmother. John was so excited. "Welcome grandmother!" he said. 

Grandmother walked in with a big smile. She had a big sack in her hands. "I brought you a surprise," said Grandmother. John opened the sack and saw lots of candy inside. He was so happy! 

John said 'thank you' to his grandmother and ate the candy. After he ate them, he felt a little bit ashamed. He had eaten all the candy without sharing. 

Grandmother smiled. She said, "It's okay to feel ashamed. But then you can say sorry, and be more generous next time." John hugged his grandmother and said, "I'm sorry and I'll share next time!" Grandmother nodded with a smile.

One day, a little girl was walking in the woods. She was feeling kind and wanted to discover something new. Suddenly, she heard a buzzing noise. She looked around, and she found it. It was a mosquito! She had never seen one before and she was excited. She reached out her hand to touch it. The mosquito was very kind and stayed still. The girl was happy to have made a new friend. She thanked the mosquito, and continued her walk. She had discovered something new, and it made her feel very happy.

Billy had been looking for adventure all day. He had searched around the house, up in the trees, and even in the garden! But nothing exciting had happened.

Billy decided to go for a walk. He slowly made his way through the field, feeling the grass beneath his feet.

Suddenly, Billy stumbled and fell! He tried to get back up, but he felt clumsy and embarrassed. Billy couldn't help but feel sad. "Oh no!" He said.

Just then, a friendly little rabbit hopped up to Billy. The rabbit's soft fur was so inviting and it smiled at Billy.

Billy smiled back. He felt much better and back to his old self. He knew that the adventure he was searching for was right in front of him.

The two of them looked at each other, not knowing what the next step was. Then the little rabbit shrugged, as if to say "shall we continue on this adventure?". Billy nodded and the two of them set off into the field.

Peter was excited. Today he was going to play with water. He ran to the backyard and saw a delicate little pond filled with water. He reached out and touched it with his tiny hands. The water was cold and wet.

He smiled and asked his mom, "Can I play with the water?"

"Yes, but be careful. Water is delicate and you need to be gentle," his mom replied.

So Peter got on his hands and knees and began to touch the water. He felt the cold droplets on his fingers. Then he started to splash the water and laughed with joy.

He continued to touch the water and soon he was playing a game where he had to find the pebbles hidden underneath the surface. Peter was having a lot of fun.

He continued to play in the water until it was time to go inside. He felt a bit sad to leave but he promised himself that he would come back tomorrow.

Once upon a time there was a patient bear. Every day he would go out and trade with all the animals in the woods. One day he was going to meet a rabbit for a trade, but as he walked he slipped on a stone. He was careful for the rest of the way, but deep down he knew that something bad was coming soon. 

When he arrived at the rabbit's house, he was shocked to find out that all his trades had been cancelled. Disappointed, the bear went home. But the next day, he decided to try again. 

This time, he made sure he was extra careful, even though it took him a long time to get to the rabbit's house. When he arrived, he was so pleased to find out that all his trades had been saved! The patient bear was so happy that he decided to slip on a stone to celebrate.

Once upon a time, there were two friends. Their names were Bob and Jill. Bob and Jill were walking down the street when they saw a puppy. It was so cute and charming! They admired the puppy and Bob wanted to pet it.

Bob said to Jill, "Let's stay and play with the puppy!" Jill smiled. They sat down and pet the puppy. It was so soft and fun!
