They hugged each other, feeling very jolly. Together, they had found a solution to the itch and they were proud of their achievement. 

The story ends here, but Sally and Timmy continued to be friends and always had lots of jolly fun.

Once upon a time, there was a black jungle. It was dark and spooky in the jungle.

One day, a little girl went exploring in the jungle. She was wearing a big, long, green jungle hat. As she walked along, she heard a loud snap! The little girl was scared.

But then she saw a big black snake! The snake didn't see her, so the little girl was brave and picked up a stick. She waved the stick around, and the snake snapped away! The little girl was so excited!

The little girl kept exploring the black jungle and had lots of fun. She even made a few new friends! From then on, she went exploring in the jungle all the time. She was never afraid of the snapping snakes!

Once upon a time there was a dog named Max. Max was a very happy dog who enjoyed playing in the garden. One day, Max was playing and wearing his collar. His collar was bright blue and sparkly. 

Suddenly, Max spotted a small mouse eating something tasty in the garden. He knew it was wrong but he just had to have a taste. He walked up to the mouse and told him that he wanted to try the tasty food. So the mouse let Max have a tiny bite. 

Max loved it so much that he asked the mouse if he could have more. The mouse said no and ran away. But Max didn't mind at all. His collar sparkled in the sun and he was happy. He was so happy he even began to sing. The end.

Jack was a brave little boy who loved to climb. Jack had to go to the park every week with his tutor. One day when he got there, he thought it looked like the perfect place to climb. He saw a big tree and asked his tutor if he could climb it.

His tutor said that it looked dangerous, so Jack had to think of something else. He saw a slide and said that he wanted to climb that instead. His tutor said that it was ok, so Jack ran to the slide.

Jack had so much fun climbing the slide that he almost forgot he was with his tutor. He made it all the way to the top and shouted with joy. His tutor then reminded him to be careful and not to do anything dangerous.

Jack agreed and made his way back down the slide. He ran off to play, still with a smile on his face from his fun climb!

Once upon a time, there was a little boy named Max. He wanted to go on a trip with his family, but he was very tired. So he stayed home alone.

He looked out the window to see everyone already off on their trip. He felt sad that he wasn't part of the family fun. Suddenly he heard a loud noise coming from the backyard.

He went outside to investigate. To his surprise, he saw the familyâ€™s old tree rotting away. Max was so disappointed. He decided that he needed to do something. 

He decided to take a nap to try and forget about the rotted tree. He thought maybe he could think of a way to make things right when he woke up. 

When Max woke up a few hours later, he found that the tree had completely rotted away. There was nothing Max could do. He felt so sad that he was away while this happened. He wished he had been there to prevent it from rotting. Then he sadly realized that he was too tired to help.
 
The end.

Once upon a time, a little girl called Anna loved the beach. She would dream of the amazing sand and the calming blue sea. 

One day, Anna asked her mum if they could go to the beach and she said yes. So off they went to the beach, with bags full of toys and snacks. 

Anna was so excited when she saw the beach and all the amazing shells. She started spending her day building sandcastles and playing with her toys. 

Suddenly, it started to rain. Anna was worried and so was her mum. They gathered all the toys, grabbed their bags and ran quickly to the car. 

But as they got close, Anna saw a most amazing sight. The rain had made all of the sand sparkle and shimmer. As a special treat, her mum said they could stay and watch. 

So Anna stayed, bouncing up and down in amazement. After a while, the rain stopped and the wonderful beach shone. Anna had a most amazing day.

Once there was an elderly man who was very tired. One day he decided to take a nap in the yard. He lay down in the grass under the big tree on the west side of the yard.

A curious three year old girl and her little brother had been playing in the yard. When they saw the man, they ran over to him.

"Mister, why are you taking a nap?" asked the little girl.

The elderly man smiled at them. "I'm very tired, so I'm taking a nap," he said.

The little girl's brother pulled on her arm and said, "Come on, let's take a nap too!"

The girl giggled. "OK," she said, and she lay down next to the man in the grass.

The elderly man smiled, watching the little girl and her brother snuggle close and fall asleep. After a while, he dozed off too.

The day was almost over and the sun was close to the horizon. As the sun slowly moved closer to the sky, Charlie was playing in the backyard. He was playing with his yellow toy truck and pushing it around in circles.

As he kept playing, the sky grew darker and the colors around him changed. He watched as the sun slowly disappeared and darkness spread over the sky. But just before the sun was gone, Charlie saw the most beautiful sight- a yellow sunset! 

He was mesmerized. He had never seen something so beautiful before. In that moment, he knew he would always remember the brilliant yellow sunset. 

He smiled from ear to ear and kept playing as the sky grew darker and darker. Even as the night came, he stayed there in the backyard playing with his truck. When it was time to go to bed, he snuggled in his bed and fell asleep with a special memory of the magical yellow sunset.

Once upon a time, there was a little girl named Jess. Jess liked to play with her toys, but one day, Jess had a special task to do. She had to take all the clothes out of her wardrobe and hang them up on hangers.

Jess was a very polite little girl and she was very excited to do her special task. She started to take the clothes out of her wardrobe and carefully hang them up on the hangers.

When Jess was almost finished, she heard a noise behind her. It was her mom.

Jess' mom said "Jess, you have done such a good job! You have been very polite and you have hung up all of the clothes very carefully. You did a great job!"

Jess was very proud of herself and gave her mom a big hug. She was happy she had been able to help out.

Once, there were two friends, Marley and Alex, who loved to play together. One day, they decided to play with Marley's toy boat in the pond. 

The boat had a thick hull, so they were sure it wouldn't leak. But as they sailed the boat around the pond, they noticed water started to quickly fill it up! 

Marley: "Alex! The boat is leaking!"
Alex: "We gotta find a way to stop the leak!" 
 
They started to think up ideas. Marley suggested using a patch to cover the leak. Alex hopped back to his house to grab one. 

When Alex returned to the pond, he applied the patch to the hull. The thick patch was the perfect size and stopped the leak! 

They were so relieved and excited to continue playing with the boat. They had learned save the day, and also had lots of fun!

Once there was a little girl named Amy. Every morning her mother used to give her a special case to take with her to school. In it was a healthy snack, an extra dress and a special toy.

One day, when Amy was getting ready for school, her mother said: "Amy, please don't forget to take your case with you."

Amy replied: "I know mummy, I always take it."

At school, the teacher asked the children to share their snacks with the other children. When it was Amy's turn, she looked into the case and saw that it was almost empty. She had eaten all the snacks without thinking about sharing them.

Amy was ashamed of her behaviour, so she politely said to the teacher: "I'm sorry, I didn't bring a snack for the other children."

The teacher hugged Amy and said: "It's ok, but from now on, you should always share with others, it's not regular to keep everything for yourself." 

Amy was happy that her teacher taught her such an important lesson: always share with others!

Once upon a time, there was a hairy pup. It was so small that it could fit in one hand. Every day, the pup grew bigger and bigger. Soon, it was just as big as the curtain from the window. 

The pup liked playing with the curtain. He would wrestle it and climb around it. Nothing was as much fun as the curtain.

One day, the pup was running around the room and suddenly, he got tangled up in the curtain. He couldn't free himself, so he started barking for help. His mom heard him and quickly came to the rescue. She freed him from the curtain.

After that, the pup kept his distance from the curtain. He liked playing around it, but he knew enough to stay away from it now. He was happy that he was a little smarter!

Once upon a time, there were two friends named Susy and Joe. They were best friends, and did everything together. One day, they decided to go to the beach. They had a lot of fun. The sun was shining, and the sand felt warm.

The two friends found a big shell. It was very shiny, and it was the perfect shape. Susy and Joe both thought it was the most wonderful thing they had ever seen. They both wanted the shell, and they started to argue.

Susy started to yell. "I saw it first! It's mine!", she shouted. Joe was angry. He started to yell too. "No! I saw it first! It's mine!", he shouted. 

Suddenly a third person appeared. He was very popular around the beach. He had a kind smile. He quietly said "I think it would be nice if you two shared the shell. That way, you could both be happy."

But Susy and Joe didn't listen. They just kept yelling and arguing. The popular man sadly shook his head and walked away. 

Susy and Joe never got to keep the shell. In the end, neither one was happy.

There was a woman, named Joanne, who loved to teach people. Every day, she would go to the park and teach the children who went there. One day, a little boy came to the park and didn't know very much about the world around him. He was very ignorant. 

Joanne saw this and asked the little boy what he wanted to learn. He looked up at Joanne with his big, innocent eyes and said he wanted to learn about everything. 

Joanne smiled and said, "Let me teach you then." She began to show him the park and taught him about the plants and the birds. She explained to him the importance of being kind to the people and animals around him. 

By the end of the day, the little boy was not ignorant anymore. He thanked Joanne for teaching him and said he was going to be kind to everyone in the park. Joanne was proud of the little boy and smiled. 

The moral of the story is that teaching someone is a great way to make a difference. Everyone needs to be taught something in order to gain knowledge. Teaching someone not only helps them learn, but also opens up their eyes to the world around them.

Once upon a time there were two friends who loved to explore. One day they decided to leave their home and go on an adventure. So they packed up their things and headed to the harbor.

But when they arrived at the harbor the waves were big and the wind was strong. It was clear that the crossing was going to be difficult.

The friends did not know how to get across, but after a while they came up with a plan. They made a raft and set sail for the other side.

They worked together and soon the tricky crossing was completed. The friends were so proud of themselves for overcoming the difficult journey.

They finally reached the other side, and the adventure could continue!

Once upon a time, there were two friends called Amy and Ben. 

Amy was a little girl and was three years old. Ben was an orange crane. 

One day, Amy and Ben decided to go on an adventure. 

So they started to march towards the forest. The sun was shining and they were happy.

Suddenly, it started to rain. Amy and Ben were getting wet!

They stopped and looked around. 

Amy said to Ben: "What do we do now?". 

Ben replied, "Let's march a bit further. I think I can see a dry spot over there."

And so Amy and Ben marched again. The rain finally stopped and they eventually made it to the dry spot. 

Amy and Ben had lots of fun and enjoyed their adventure. They were happy to have made it to the dry spot!

Once upon a time, there was a little boy called Max. Max wanted to go on an adventure. He put on his shoes and coat and went outside. He started to walk along the path that led out of the village. 

As he walked, he came across a farm. There were so many animals there! He could see horses, cows and sheep. The farm was so big and the animals were so cute!

Max wanted to go and pet one of the animals, but he was scared. He thought he might scare them away. So he just kept walking around the farm. Then, suddenly he noticed a sweet smell. It was coming from a little barn next to the farm.

Max went into the barn and saw a pile of hay. When he touched it, it was so soft! Then he heard something moving inside. It was a small, white, fluffy kitten!

Max kneeled down and said hello to the kitten. The kitten replied in a sweet voice. They talked for a bit and then the little kitten asked Max to come back again another day.

Max said goodbye to the kitten and left the little barn. As he started to walk home he thought to himself, "Farms can be so much fun!"

Once upon a time, there was a very huge bear. He had a lot of fur all over his body. In the summer, the bear was very warm, so he decided to remove some of his fur.
He scratched and scratched until all of his fur was gone, leaving him feeling very cold.
The bear jumped up and down to try and stay warm, but nothing worked. He started to shiver and shake until he felt very cold.
Then, he got a bright idea. He decided to ask his friends for help. He asked the rabbits to give him some of their fur to keep him warm.
The rabbits were so kind that they gave him all of their fur. The bear was so happy and he put it all on. Finally, he was warm and could go on to have a nice day.

One day, Ted was playing in the garden with his toy car. Suddenly, he heard a loud noise. It was coming from inside his house. Ted was scared, so he ran inside to hide. 

He opened the freezer door and crept inside. It was cold, but he felt safe. When the noise stopped, Ted came out of the freezer and looked around. 

He noticed the dangerous smoke coming from the kitchen. His mom was in there, trying to put out a fire. She yelled out, â€œTed, stay away! Itâ€™s too dangerous!â€ 

Ted stayed back and watched, but he wanted to help. Then he had an idea. He got a bucket of water and put out the fire. His mom smiled and said, â€œThank you for protecting us.â€ 

From that moment on, Ted knew that he could always protect those he loved. He was brave and strong.

Alice and Bob were walking in the park.
Alice said, "Let's go to the office".
Bob replied, "OK".
When they arrived, the office was empty. Alice put her hand into her sack, and took out a key. She used the key to open the door, and they both went inside.
Bob looked around and said, "It's so empty in here".
Alice smiled and said, "Let's make it better".
Bob looked in his sack and took out some crayons and paper. Alice got out a teddy bear and started drawing on the paper.
They both laughed and made the office look much better.

Once upon a time there was a happy dog named Bob. Bob loved the dark because that was when he could do all his fun games. 

One night Bob went into the dark, but he forgot something very important - to listen!  He stumbled around quietly, hoping not to wake anyone up.

Suddenly he heard a small voice. It said, â€œHello there! Who are you?â€ Bob was so surprised! It was a little mouse peeking out from a crack in the wall.  

The mouse said, â€œWhy don't you come and play with me in the dark? I can show you all sorts of fun things.â€ Bob was really excited and said yes! He followed the mouse and they began to play. 

Bob and the mouse had so much fun in the dark together. Through the night they laughed and played together until it was time to go home. Bob thanked the mouse and smiled a happy goodbye.

Once upon a time, there lived a little dog called Pippy. Pippy lived with her best friend, a little girl named Jenna. Jenna loved to dress Pippy up in all sorts of silly costumes. Pippy always felt silly but she loved spending time with Jenna, so she put up with it. 

One day Jenna decided to put Pippy in a special Halloween costume. It had a big pumpkin head on it. Poor Pippy felt so stupid but she still followed Jenna around the park. 

Suddenly Jenna stopped and pointed to a big skeleton. Jenna said, "Look! That's a scary skeleton! I bet it's not very nice!" 

That's when Pippy noticed the skeleton was holding a big juicy bone. Pippy got so excited she forgot how silly she looked and ran over to the skeleton. She decided to try and chew the bone away from the skeleton. 

The skeleton was held together by magic and it wiggled back and forth trying to get away. Pippy chewed and chewed and eventually the bone came free! Jenna and Pippy laughed and ran off with the bone. 

They made it all the way back to the park before Pippy looked down at her costume and remembered how stupid she looked. But Jenna just smiled and said, "That's ok Pippy! You were brave and that's all that matters."

Once upon a time, there was a little girl named Molly. She was three years old. She loved to play with her colorful scarves. 
One day she asked her mom if she could help cook for dinner. Her mom smiled and said, "Of course!" 
Molly helped her mom mix together all the delicious ingredients for the dinner. 
When it was done her mom tasted it and said, "This is delicious!". 
Molly wanted to taste it too, so she asked for a spoon. Her mom said, "No, you have to wait until after dinner". 
Molly was sad, but she waited patiently. 
At dinner time, her mom said, "Molly, you did such a great job helping to make this delicious dinner! Here, have a little taste". 
Molly tasted it and smiled.

The moral of the story is to be patient and wait for the right time. If you wait, you'll be rewarded. And if you work hard, you'll be proud of your accomplishments.

Once there was a little girl named Daisy and she was three years old. Daisy loved giving her mom a kiss every day and her mom always said, "You know what? I'm saving up your kisses for a special holiday!" 

When the holidays came, Daisy was so excited. She couldn't wait to give all the kisses to her mom. She ran to her bedroom and found a present waiting with a big bow on it. When she opened it, she saw a big card that said, "I'm so happy to have you in my life and your kisses are the most special thing of all!" 

Daisy hugged her mom and they hugged each other so tight. Daisy said, "Mom, I want to give you a lot of kisses to show you how much I love you!" Her mom said, "That's so kind of you, but wait! I have one more surprise for you!" 

In Daisy's bedroom, there was a basketball hoop! Daisy couldn't wait to get started. She said, "Oh, I can play ball every day!" Her mom said, "Yes, and I have a special court available too!" Daisy was so excited that she gave her mom even more kisses! 

Daisy was so happy to have a basketball hoop and a special court for her to play on during the holidays. She knew she was really lucky and so she gave her mom lots of kisses to show her love and her

Once upon a time there was a brave bear called Burt. Burt lived in a small cave at the edge of the woodland and he loved to explore. One day, he heard a noise coming from a nearby tree. Burt thought it was strange, so he decided to investigate. As he got closer, he noticed a small nail in the tree trunk and he knew that someone must have put it there.

Burt was brave, so he decided to see what would happen if he pulled out the nail. He used all his strength to pull it out and then stepped back to see what would happen. To his surprise, the tree started to shake and suddenly the whole tree split in two. Inside was a small magical chest filled with lots of shiny coins.

Burt smiled. He had found something special and he was so brave for pulling out the nail. From then on, Burt was never short of coins to buy whatever he wanted. He thought to himself that being brave was very rewarding.

Once upon a time there was a man that wanted to have loads of fun. So every day he would play with his toys and not do anything else. He would laugh and have a great time and not think about the future. 

One day he decided that he wanted to build a treehouse, so he got some wood and nails and started to build. But it took him a long time to finish and he got very frustrated. He eventually decided it was too hard and got angry and threw all the wood and nails away. 

He needed to learn that with hard work and time you can build lots of wonderful things. He needed to stop being so stupid and put his toys away and focus on his treehouse. 

So after awhile, he learnt his lesson and started to work on his treehouse again. With lots of hard work and patience, he was able to build a strong and sturdy treehouse. 

The man learnt a valuable lesson that day. With time and hard work, you can build anything you want. Don't be stupid and think it will all happen quickly. Take time and don't give up.

Mama was very busy with her work today and she had a deadline to meet, so she told her daughter to be very patient. Her daughter had never been asked to do such a difficult thing before--be patient and not interrupt right away. But eventually, the little girl did as she was told and waited and waited. 

Finally, the time came and Mama got her paycheck. The little girl saw it when Mama was counting and she noticed a penny! She was so excited that she shouted "Can I have it, Mama? Can I use it?". But Mama replied: "No, sweetheart. I'm sorry. This penny is too delicate for us to play with. You'll just have to delay having a penny for a little while."

The little girl was a bit sad about the delay, but she nodded in understanding. Mama told her that one day she would get a penny of her own--a nice shiny new one! This made the little girl very happy and she couldn't wait for Mama to give her the coin. 

Days passed, and one day the little girl's birthday arrived. Mama gave her a special gift: a shiny new penny just for her! Now the little girl could play with it and treasure it forever. 

It was a delayed pleasure, but now the little girl knows that she finally has her penny!

Once upon a time, there was a tough cow. He was carrying a napkin in his mouth. He was so proud of himself and he wanted to be the strongest cow in the world.

One day, the cow decided to walk to a nearby farm. He thought he'd have some fun there. When he got to the farm, he tried to find something he could lift, but everything seemed too heavy for him.

Then he saw a big rock. He tried to lift it, but it was too tough for him. Suddenly, he remembered the napkin he was carrying in his mouth. He put it over the rock and started to push with all his might. 

Finally, the rock started to move. He was so proud that he could move something so heavy. The other cows in the farm were happy too! They clapped and cheered for the tough cow.

From then on, the cow was the strongest cow in the world and the other cows respected him. He would always carry his napkin with him and it reminded the other cows of the tough cow who could carry anything.

Once there was a little girl called Claire. She was three years old and she loved to paint. Every day she would pull out her paintbrushes and paint a new picture.

One day, Claire's mom said to her: "Would you like some toast with cheese?". Claire was very excited. She said "Yes please!" 

Claire's mom cut two slices of toast and put cheese on top. She put them in the toaster and waited for the toast to get nice and golden. When the toast was ready, she put it on a plate for Claire 

"It looks easy to eat" said Claire "May I paint on it?" Claire's mom said "Sure! Put some more colors on it". 

Claire was overjoyed! She quickly grabbed her paintbrushes and brightened the toast with all sorts of colors. When she was done, Claire's mom said "That looks very pretty! Now let's eat it before it gets cold". 

Claire and her mom sat down at the table and ate the painted toast. It tasted delicious! 

From then on, Claire loved to paint her toast before eating. It made mealtime even more fun!

One day, a clown went to the park. He was wearing a big, colourful hat and sunnies. He was getting ready to perform a show.

The children were so excited; they couldn't wait to see the clown. They clapped and jumped around. The clown jumped up and down too, always smiling.

The clown started the show and started to juggle the bright, shiny balls. The children laughed and clapped their hands. But then the juggled balls fell on the ground. The clown was so impatient, he felt very sad.

But then suddenly, a small boy picked up the balls and gave them back to the clown. The clown thanked him with a big smile and started juggling again. He performed his show and everyone had lots of fun. They all thanked the little boy for being so helpful.

It was a bright summer day and Jake's parents had taken him to the park. He saw some of his friends playing football, and he was filled with joy. He managed to get the ball from them and started running around with it. Everyone was cheering and smiling.

Jake's mom watched from afar. She saw that Jake was having so much fun and decided to go join in. She asked them to let her play too, and everyone indluded her. They were all having a great time.

Then, a group of older boys approached. They watched the children play and one of them said "Hey! That kid is really good. Let's challenge him to a game".

Jake was a bit scared at first, but his mom encouraged him. "Go on, Jake! You can do it!", she said.

The game began and Jake was determined to do his best. He managed to score many goals, and the older boys were envious. They had been sure they would win, but they hadn't expected Jake to be so good.

At the end of the game, Jake was ultimately declared winner. His mom was so proud and she hugged him tightly. Everyone than thanked Jake for the entertaining game, and everyone left smiling.

Once upon a time there was a very sad boy. He was always very sad because he had a secret that no one else knew. This secret made him suffer very much. His secret was hidden away deep inside his heart and he never wanted anyone to find it.

One day the boy went to the store and bought a special lotion. It was a magical lotion that was said to give a person strength when they were sad. So the boy decided to try it and see if it helped his suffering.

He opened the bottle and ran the lotion all over his body. He laughed as he felt the healing power of the lotion work its magic. He felt happiness and relief from the secret he had been keeping for so long.

The boy was so thankful for the lotion that he went around and told everyone about it. Everyone was amazed at the power of this lotion to help him. Finally, his secret was hidden no more.

Once there was a squirrel who liked to play. He would run and leap and have fun. He had lots of friends and they all enjoyed playing together. 

One day, the squirrel was playing near a bad tree. The tree had bad leaves, and the squirrel knew not to go near it. But he was feeling brave, and he decided to explore. 

The squirrel climbed the bad tree and a branch broke. He fell to the ground and hurt his leg. He tried to get away, but he was too scared. 

The squirrel looked for help, but no one came. He felt so sad and scared. In the end, the bad tree won, and the squirrel had to stay there forever.

Once upon a time there lived a very patient little bear. He lived in a small cave deep in the forest. One day, the bear thought he'd make something to eat so he took out a big pot and his special stick. He filled the pot with some delicious ingredients and put it onto the stove. 

When the bear started to stir the mixture, he heard a noise coming from the pot. He stopped stirring, wondering what it could be. Out of the pot popped a little mouse. 

The bear said, "hello, what do you want?" 

The little mouse replied, "I wanted some of the yummy food you are cooking!" 

The bear was so patient and kindly said, "of course you can! Take as much as you'd like!" 

The mouse was so happy and thanked the bear as he helped himself to some food. After the mouse left, the bear continued stirring his food. He was sure glad to be so patient.

Once upon a time there was a cute, little bear. He was looking for fun and wanted to go out and play. So he put on his warm coat and set out on an adventure. 

The bear walked through the woods, jumping over logs and walking through mud. Then he heard a sound coming from a nearby river. It was a cold, gushing stream. He wanted to pass it but he was scared of the cold water. 

The bear looked around, looking for a safe way to get across the stream. Then he saw a bridge that was very low to the ground and he thought he could pass over it easily. 

He hopped onto the bridge, one foot in front of the other and walked slowly across. He made it to the other side, safe and sound. The bear had passed the cold stream and was back into the woods. He was ready for his next adventure, feeling excited and ready!

Once there was a small girl who was so very lonely. She sat in the middle of the busy street, looking at all the traffic as it streamed by. 

"Can anyone play with me?" she pled.

Suddenly, right in front of her, she heard a voice reply, "Yes! We can play together!"

The voice belonged to a bright yellow bird who had landed right beside the girl. The two of them were together and suddenly the street seemed much less lonely.

The bird and the girl played together, running up and down the street, and repeating the same running game over and over. 

Finally, tired from all the running, the little girl said to the bird, "I don't want to go home just yet." 

The bird said, "We don't have to go yet. We can keep playing till it's dark, and then I will take you back. We can repeat the same game again and again, just like the traffic does in this street." 

The little girl smiled and the two continued to play, no longer feeling lonely.

Once upon a time, there was a mommy, a daddy, and a little girl. The little girl was very proud.

One day, there was a big rain, and it made the mommy and daddy sad. The little girl was still proud.

The mommy said to the little girl, â€œLetâ€™s go outside and wave at the rain until it stops.â€ The little girl smiled and they went outside.

The little girl was waving at the rain and the mommy and daddy were proud of her. The rain slowly stopped and the sky was bright again. The mommy and daddy hugged the little girl and said, â€œGood job!â€ 

The little girl smiled and was proud.

Jim was walking in a big park one day. He was very happy. Suddenly, something caught his eye. It was a movie! He had never seen one before and he was very eager to watch it. 

Jim ran up to the screen, excited to see what was playing. But the movie was too harsh for him. He started to tear up. His little heart felt heavy and he couldn't stop the tears.

But then, something amazing happened. A kind stranger handed him a tissue and gave him a big hug. Jim felt much better and he smiled. 

The stranger showed him a different movie and it was much nicer. Together, they laughed and clapped and had too much fun! 

Jim was so thankful. He had a wonderful time with his new friend!

Once there were two friends named Tom and Sarah. Tom was very shy and Sarah was very loud. One day, Sarah shouted, "Let's go find some cheese!" Tom couldn't believe it. "Where will we find it?" he asked. Sarah knew exactly what she wanted. She shouted out again, "Let's find some big cheese!"

Tom was excited. They looked around and soon found a big, yellow cheese. Sarah shouted, "It's so big!" She picked up the cheese and laughed. Tom couldn't believe it. They had found the best cheese ever! 

The two friends ran back home with the big cheese. Sarah shouted, "Let's make a big, cheesy pizza!" Tom was so excited. They made the biggest, cheesiest pizza ever. Everyone in their neighbourhood could smell the delicious aroma. 

Tom and Sarah shared the big, cheesy pizza with their friends and family. Everyone cheered and shouted with joy. What a wonderful day!

Once upon a time, there was a little girl. She was colorful and lived in the city. She liked playing in the park and running around. One day, when she was playing in the park, she saw a tiger. She was surprised and a little scared. 

The tiger looked at her and said, "Come here, little girl. I am friendly." The little girl was still worried, but she stepped closer.

The tiger said, "Do you want to become a tiger with me?" The little girl was amazed and said, "Yes! I want to become a tiger." 

The little girl and the tiger danced and had fun in the park. Then, the little girl started to change. She had tiger stripes and a tail. She had become a colorful tiger!

The little girl and the tiger ran around the park together and had lots of fun. They were the best friends.

Once upon a time, there was a little bunny who wanted to go outside and have some fun. He asked his mum if he could go out but she said no, because it was raining. He was so sorry that he couldn't go out and play, so he stayed inside and played instead.

Afterwards, he heard the rain slowing down, so he got very excited and asked his mum if he could go out and play now. His mum said yes, so he quickly put on his coat and boots and ran outside.

The bunny was so happy that he could go out and play, he laughed and jumped around in the rain. He ran around until he got so wet that he was almost swimming, then he ran back inside. His mum smiled as he came in, and said "Time for a nice warm bath!"

Once upon a time, there was a reliable octopus who loved to zoom around in the big ocean. He zoomed and zoomed all day long, moving very quickly and never getting tired. 

The octopus had so much fun zooming around giving all his sea friends rides, like the little fish, the blue whale and the seahorse.

But one day, something went wrong. The reliable octopus got caught in a net! He struggled to get out and get back to his zooming. 

Then something wonderful happened. Another octopus came to help! He used his tentacles to pull the net apart and set the first octopus free!

The reliable octopus was so happy he began to zoom around in circles, giving high fives to the other octopus and saying thank you!

From that day on, the reliable octopus was always grateful for the help and kindheartedness of the other octopus. They were the best of friends, and they both loved to zoom around the big ocean together.

John was a sad little boy. He felt so miserable. He wanted to run away from home.

So one night he did just that. He grabbed his jacket and opened the door. He ran out into the night. 

John ran and ran until he got to a big building. The building was made of steel. It looked so big and imposing that he felt even more miserable.

But John was brave. He kept running until he reached the entrance. He opened the door and looked inside. 

The inside of the building was much brighter than he expected. He smiled and ran inside to explore. 

The end.

Once there was a curious little girl. She wanted to find a treasure. But to get it she had to ride her bike very far.

She had heard there was a treasure far away in the woods. She thought it would be hard to get there but she was very excited.

The next day, she got on her bike and began to ride. After a few hours of riding her tires started to get flat. The little girl was worried and looked around for help.

Just then, she spotted a cute bunny hopping by. It looked friendly and she decided to trust it. The bunny hopped closer and motioned for her to follow it.

The little girl followed the bunny deep into the woods. After a while they reached a clearing. There, in the center was a large chest.

The little girl realized she had gotten her treasure! She was so excited. From then on she would always take her bicycle on adventures in the woods.

Once upon a time, there lived a little girl named Kiki. She was three years old and lived in a village with her family.

One day, Kiki's mom told her to go settle the chickens in their coop. Kiki was excited to do something for her mom and she ran to the backyard. After a few minutes of trying to set the chickens in the coop, Kiki started to get frustrated.

Suddenly, Kiki heard a voice from behind her. 
"Kiki, why don't you let me help you? It looks like you need some help!"

Kiki turned around and saw a silly old man with a big hat. Kiki wanted to help her mom on her own, but the old man seemed to think he could do it better. Kiki felt a bit stupid and said, "No, I can do it on my own!"

The old man laughed and said, "Nonsense! Give me a chance and I'm sure I can settle the chickens in this tiny little village much better than you could."

Kiki was still a bit stubborn, but she eventually let the old man give her a hand. When they finished, Kiki thanked him and ran back to her mom. Kiki learned that it's sometimes okay to ask for help--even if it can feel a bit stupid at first.

Once upon a time, there were two friends: Sam and Lucy. Sam was a jolly boy and he always had a smile on his face. Lucy was also a happy girl, but she was often in bad moods.

One day, Lucy and Sam were walking in the forest, looking for something nice. When they passed by a big tree, Lucy saw something that caught her eye. She smiled and said to Sam, "Look! It's a lovely doll in that tree!"

But when she looked closer, she didn't find it. She was sad and angry. Then, Sam said to her, "Don't worry, let's keep looking. We will find something nice."

So, they kept on walking. Soon, they found a basket with jolly toys. Lucy was excited and she smiled widely. She said to Sam, "We found something nice! I'm so happy!"

At that moment, Sam and Lucy learned an important lesson: nothing ever passes by if you look hard with a positive attitude. Often, you find what you are looking for only when you can keep a jolly spirit.

Once upon a time, there was a little girl named Lily. She loved to go outside and play in the park. One day, Lily was playing on the swings when she saw a big storm coming. She quickly ran to her mom and said, "Mommy, there's a storm coming!"

Her mom picked her up and they went inside. Lily was scared of the loud thunder, but her mom held her tight and made her feel safe. After the storm passed, Lily felt happy that she was independent enough to tell her mom about the storm and stay safe inside. From then on, Lily knew that she could always go to her mom for help when she needed it.

Once upon a time, there was a clever little girl named Lily. She loved to play with her toys and go on adventures. One day, Lily's mom took her to the park to play. While they were playing, Lily saw a butterfly and chased after it. She ran and ran until she couldn't see her mom anymore.

Lily looked around, but everything looked different. She couldn't remember how to get back to her mom. She felt scared and sad. Just when she thought she would never find her way back, she heard her mom calling her name. Lily was so happy to see her mom again, and she hugged her tight.

"Mommy, I was lost and scared. I thought I would never see you again," Lily said.

"I'm so glad we found each other. Remember, if we ever get separated, stay where you are and call out my name. I will always come to find you. And now, let's go home and make some happy memories together," her mom said.

From that day on, Lily always remembered her mom's advice. And whenever she felt lost or scared, she knew that it would all end well because her mom would always be there for her.

Once upon a time, there was a little girl named Lily. She loved to play outside and watch the pretty colors in the sky when the sun went down. That was called a sunset. 

One day, Lily's mom made her a yummy snack. It was a big, juicy apple. Lily took a bite and it tasted so good! She loved the way it tasted. 

Later that day, Lily and her mom went on a walk. They saw some birds flying in the sky and some flowers growing in the grass. Lily thought it was all so crazy and fun. 

As the sun started to go down, Lily and her mom sat on a bench and watched the sunset. It was so beautiful with all the colors in the sky. Lily thought it was the best day ever!

Once upon a time, there was a little girl named Lily. She loved to play outside in her backyard, but her mommy always told her to stay inside the fence. Lily didn't like the fence because it made her feel trapped, but she trusted her mommy and knew it was for her own safety.

One day, Lily was feeling very sleepy and wanted to take a nap. She asked her mommy if she could take a nap outside, but her mommy said no because she was afraid Lily would wander outside the fence while she was sleeping. Lily was sad, but she trusted her mommy and took a nap inside the house.

When she woke up, Lily saw that her mommy had put up a little tent inside the fence for her to play in. Lily was so happy and grateful that her mommy had thought of her and kept her safe. From then on, Lily never felt trapped by the fence again because she knew her mommy was always looking out for her.

Once upon a time, there was a little girl named Lily who had a big heart. She loved animals and always hoped to help them. One day, she found a little bird with a hurt wing. She took the bird home and cared for it. 

Lily's mom said, "You are so smart to know how to help the bird." 

Lily replied, "I hope the bird gets better soon."

Days went by and the bird started to fly again. Lily was so happy and let the bird go free. But one day, Lily found the bird dead on the ground. She was very sad and her heart felt heavy. 

Lily said, "I hope the bird is in a better place now."

Once upon a time, there was a little girl named Lily. She loved to play outside in the park with her friends. One day, her mom told her that they were going on a picnic. Lily was very excited and asked her mom, "What way are we going?"

"We are going to take the car," her mom replied. "It's the safest way to get there."

When they arrived at the park, Lily and her friends ran around and played. But when it was time to eat, Lily's mom reminded her to use a fork to eat her food. "It's the proper way to eat," her mom said.

Lily enjoyed her picnic and had a lot of fun. As they were leaving, Lily turned to her mom and said, "I had so much fun today. Can we do it again sometime?"

Once upon a time, there was a little girl named Lily. She loved to eat sweets and candies. One day, she went to the candy store with her mom.

Lily looked at all the candies and chocolates with different colors and shapes. Her mom suggested that she should try a candy with a bumpy texture. Lily was not sure, but her mom said it might be tasty.

Lily tried the candy and it was delicious! She loved the bumpy texture and the tasty flavor. She thanked her mom for suggesting it to her. From that day on, Lily always tried new candies with different textures and flavors.

Once upon a time, there was a little girl named Lily. She loved to collect pretty stones and shells at the beach. One day, she saw a wide seashell that she really wanted to add to her collection. But it was in the water and she couldn't reach it.

Her friend, a boy named Max, came by and saw her trying to get the seashell. "I can help you pass it to you," he said kindly. And so, he helped her get the seashell.

Lily was very happy and thanked Max for his help. She learned that it's always nice to help others and that friends are there to help each other collect the things they love.

Once upon a time, there was a sleepy bear named Bubba. Bubba lived on a street with lots of trees and flowers. One day, Bubba was walking down the street when he saw his friend, a little bird named Tweetie. 

"Hi Tweetie!" said Bubba. "How are you today?"

"I'm good," said Tweetie. "But I need to go to sleep soon. It's getting late."

Bubba looked around and saw that the sun was going down. "You're right," he said. "It's time to close our eyes and go to sleep."

Bubba and Tweetie said goodnight to each other and went to their homes. Bubba crawled into his cozy cave and closed his eyes. He fell asleep right away, dreaming of all the fun things he would do with Tweetie tomorrow.

Once upon a time, there was a big jungle. In the jungle lived many animals like lions, monkeys, and elephants. One day, a little monkey named Max was feeling sad because he wanted to eat a banana, but he couldn't find any.

Max decided to ask his friends for help. He saw a helpful lion and asked him if he had any bananas. The lion said no, but he would help Max find some. They searched the jungle together and finally found a big bunch of bananas.

Max was so happy and thanked the lion for being so helpful. From that day on, Max knew that if he ever wanted something, he could always ask his friends in the jungle for help.

Once upon a time, there was a kind boy named Timmy. He loved to play outside and explore the woods behind his house. One day, while he was walking, he saw a little bird with a hurt wing. Timmy felt sad and wanted to help the bird.

He gently grabbed the bird and brought it to his chamber. He made a little bed for the bird and gave it some water and seeds to eat. The bird felt better and started to sing happily.

But then, Timmy's cat came into the chamber and saw the bird. The cat wanted to play with it, but Timmy knew that the cat might hurt the bird again. Timmy said to the cat, "Please be compassionate and let the bird rest. It needs to heal."

The cat listened to Timmy and left the chamber. The bird felt safe and happy in Timmy's care. Timmy knew that even though there was a conflict with the cat, he did the right thing by being kind and compassionate to the bird.

Once upon a time, there was a little girl named Lily who loved animals. One day, she went to the zoo with her mommy and daddy. They saw many animals like lions, tigers, and monkeys. But Lily wanted to see a kangaroo, which she had never seen before.

Finally, they found a kangaroo! Lily was so happy. She had never seen such a rare animal before. The kangaroo had a baby in her pouch. Lily was so excited to see the little baby kangaroo.

Lily and her family had a great time at the zoo. They were happy to have seen a kangaroo and it was a day they would never forget.

Once upon a time, there was a little girl named Lily. She loved to wander around her backyard and look at all the pretty flowers. One day, she found a journal lying on the ground. It had a clear cover with a picture of a unicorn on it. Lily picked it up and started to flip through the pages. 

Suddenly, she heard a loud noise coming from the bushes. She was scared and didn't know what to do. She decided to hide behind a tree and wait until the noise stopped. After a few minutes, she peeked out from behind the tree and saw a big dog wandering around her backyard. 

Lily knew she had to be brave and protect herself. She grabbed the journal and held it up in front of her like a shield. The dog saw her and started to bark, but Lily stood her ground. She slowly backed away and eventually the dog wandered off. Lily was relieved and wrote about her scary adventure in the journal.

Once upon a time, there was a little boy named Timmy. He loved to play soccer with his friends. One day, they decided to have a game. It was easy to play because they were all just learning. 

When the game started, Timmy's team was losing. But then, Timmy scored a goal! His friends cheered and he felt very happy. 

After the game, Timmy's mom gave him a big hug and said she was proud of him for trying his best. Timmy smiled and felt very proud too. He couldn't wait to play soccer again with his friends.

Once upon a time, there was a little boy named Timmy. Timmy loved to play outside with his friends, but one day he fell and hurt his knee. It was very painful and Timmy started to cry.

His mom saw him crying and asked what happened. Timmy told her about his fall and showed her his hurt knee. His mom hugged him and said, "Don't worry Timmy, we will make it better. We just need to clean it and put a band-aid on it to help it heal."

Timmy's mom made him a cup of coffee to help him feel better. Timmy was very patient while his mom cleaned his knee and put the band-aid on. After a few days, Timmy's knee started to heal and he was able to play outside with his friends again. The moral of the story is that if you get hurt, it's important to be patient and let your body heal.

Once upon a time, there was a little squirrel named Nutty. Nutty was very healthy because he ate lots of nuts and fruits. One day, Nutty saw a big tree with lots of nuts on it. He wanted to climb up the tree to get some nuts, but he couldn't because he hurt his leg. 

Nutty saw his friend, a little girl named Lily, walking by. He called out to her, "Lily, can you help me? I hurt my leg and I can't climb the tree to get some nuts." 

Lily said, "Sure, Nutty! I can help you. Let me crawl up the tree and get some nuts for you." 

Lily crawled up the tree and got some nuts for Nutty. Nutty was so happy and said, "Thank you, Lily! You are my best friend."

Once upon a time, there was a little boy named Timmy. One day, Timmy was playing with his toy car when he accidentally broke it. "Oh no!" cried Timmy. "My car is broken!"

Just then, a wild storm started outside. The wind was blowing and the rain was pouring down. Timmy's mom came into the room and saw that Timmy was upset. "What's wrong, Timmy?" she asked.

"My car is broken," Timmy said sadly. "But don't worry, we can fix it together," his mom said. They worked on the car while the storm raged outside, and soon it was as good as new. Timmy was so happy that he forgot all about the wild storm.

Once upon a time, there was a happy little girl who loved to play in her garden. She had a big hedge that she liked to hide behind and she was always enthusiastic when she played. One day, a bad man came to her garden and stole her favorite toy. She was very sad and didn't know what to do. 

The little girl looked for her toy everywhere, but she couldn't find it. She asked her mom for help, but her mom didn't know where it was either. The bad man had taken it and she would never see it again. 

The little girl was very upset and cried a lot. She missed her toy and her happy garden. She learned that sometimes bad people can steal things and make us sad. She never forgot her toy and always remembered to be careful around strangers.

Once upon a time, there was a little girl named Lily. She liked to play outside in the sunshine. One day, she saw a butterfly. The butterfly was very pretty and had many colors. 

Lily said, "Hello, butterfly! Can I play with you?" 

The butterfly said, "Yes, you can play with me. But I can't stay too long. I will melt if I stay in the sun too much." 

Lily said, "Oh no! I don't want you to melt. Let's go find some shade." 

They found a tree with lots of shade. The butterfly said, "Thank you for finding a shady spot for me. You are very kind." 

Lily smiled and said, "You're welcome. I like to help insects when they need it. I have some water available if you're thirsty." 

The butterfly drank the water and then flew away. Lily was happy that she could help the butterfly. She went back to playing outside, feeling proud of herself for being kind to the little insect.

Once upon a time, there was a little girl named Lily. She had a new dress that she loved very much. One day, she was playing outside and accidentally tore her dress. She was very sad and didn't know what to do. 

Her mom saw that Lily was upset and asked what happened. Lily showed her the tear in her dress. Her mom hugged her and said, "Don't worry, I will fix it for you." 

The next day, Lily received an invitation to a party. She was very excited but also nervous because she wanted to wear her new dress. When she tried it on, she saw that her mom had fixed the tear and it looked as good as new. Lily was very happy and couldn't wait to go to the party in her beautiful dress.

Once upon a time, there was a kind shark named Sammy. Sammy was very generous and always shared his food with his friends.

One day, Sammy saw a fish trapped in a cage. He asked the fish, "Do you need help?"

The fish replied, "Yes, please help me!"

Sammy knew he could help by diving down and breaking the cage open. So he did just that! The fish was free and happy.

The moral of the story is that it's important to help others when they need it. Even if it means taking a dive or going out of your way to help someone in need.

Once upon a time, there was a girl named Lily. She loved to play outside in the rain, but her mommy said it was too harsh for her. One day, while Lily was playing, it started to rain really hard. She didn't have an umbrella, so she got all wet. But then, a man with a big smile on his face came by and gave her an umbrella. Lily was so happy! She smiled and thanked the man. From that day on, Lily always brought her umbrella when she wanted to play outside in the rain.

Once upon a time, there was a little girl named Lily. She loved to eat spaghetti with tomato sauce. One day, she went to a noisy restaurant with her family. While they were eating, a sneaky thief came in and stole Lily's mom's purse. Lily was scared and sad. She didn't understand why someone would steal from her family. But then, her dad hugged her and told her everything would be okay. They finished their spaghetti and went home. From that day on, Lily learned to be careful and always keep an eye on her things.

Once upon a time, there was a big parade. Lots of people were walking and dancing. They had pretty costumes and funny hats. Suddenly, a man started to shout. He was very loud and it hurt some people's ears. But he was persistent and he kept shouting. The police came and asked him to stop, but he didn't listen. Finally, they took him away and the parade continued.

Once upon a time, there was a big bear who wanted to go on a trip. He packed his luggage with his favorite honey and went to the train station. But he didn't know which train to take. He asked his friend, a little bird, for help. The bird recommended the train that goes to the forest.

The bear got on the train and saw many animals on board. They were all going to the forest too. The bear felt happy and successful that he chose the right train. When he arrived at the forest, he saw many trees and flowers. He had a great time eating honey and playing with his new friends. He was grateful to the little bird for recommending the right train.

Once upon a time, there was a little girl named Lily. She loved to draw pictures of her family and pets. One day, she drew a picture of her mom and dad, but it didn't look quite right. 

Lily's mom asked her, "What's wrong, sweetie? Why do mommy and daddy look so funny in this picture?" 

Lily replied, "I don't know. I tried to draw them, but it didn't work." 

Her mom smiled and said, "That's okay, Lily. It's just an image. You can try again and make it better next time." 

Lily felt a little guilty for not making a good picture, but her mom hugged her and said, "Don't worry, Lily. We still love your drawings no matter what." And with that, Lily felt much better and went back to drawing more pictures.

Once upon a time, there was a big elephant. He was very regular and liked to eat lots of leaves. One day, he was walking in the jungle when he saw a small bird. The bird was scared of the elephant, but the elephant said hello and didn't want to hurt the bird.

The bird was happy and started to sing a song. The elephant liked the song and started to dance. He moved his big body and the bird flew around him. They had a lot of fun together.

After a while, the bird said goodbye and flew away. The elephant was sad, but he knew he had to yield to the bird's wishes. He continued to walk in the jungle, looking for more friends to play with.

Once upon a time, a little girl named Lily went to visit her grandma. She walked through the forest and saw a big, brown horse. The horse looked friendly and Lily wanted to bring it to her grandma's house. She asked the horse to come with her and it followed her happily.

When they arrived at grandma's house, Lily was very hungry. Her grandma made some yummy cookies and gave one to Lily. Lily wanted to share the cookie with the horse, but it couldn't eat it because it was too big. So, Lily went outside to find some grass for the horse to eat.

But when she came back, the horse was gone! Lily searched everywhere but couldn't find it. She felt sad and cried. Her grandma comforted her and said that sometimes animals like to go back to their homes. Lily felt a little better but still missed the horse. She never saw it again. The end.

Once upon a time, there was a baby named Timmy. Timmy was very little and he loved to play. One day, Timmy's mommy gave him a bath and then she wrapped him up in a towel to dry him off. Timmy giggled and wiggled as his mommy dried him with the towel. 

After Timmy was dry, his mommy put him in his crib for a nap. Timmy was very tired and he closed his eyes. As he drifted off to sleep, he thought about how much he loved his mommy. He was very thoughtful and grateful for her love and care.

When Timmy woke up from his nap, he felt so much better. He was dry and cozy in his crib. He smiled and cooed, knowing that his mommy would always take good care of him.

Once upon a time, there was a boy named Timmy. Timmy loved to watch the pigeons in the park. They were so pretty and flew so high in the sky. One day, Timmy saw a man with a noisy machine scaring the pigeons away. Timmy didn't like that.

"Hey Mister, why are you scaring the pigeons away?" Timmy asked.

"I need to clean the park. The pigeons make a mess," the man replied.

"But they are so pretty. Can't we just clean up after them?" Timmy asked.

The man thought about it and decided Timmy was right. They cleaned up after the pigeons and the park was still clean. Timmy had won the argument and the pigeons could stay. The moral of the story is that sometimes it's better to find a solution that makes everyone happy instead of just getting your own way.

Once upon a time, there was a little girl named Lily. She loved to sing and dance. One day, her mom gave her a microphone to record her singing. Lily was very happy and started singing right away. 

But then, she felt a cold breeze and started shivering. "Mom, I'm cold," she said. Her mom gave her a warm blanket to wrap around herself. 

Just then, Lily's big sister came in and said, "Lily, stop singing! You're being too bossy." Lily felt sad and stopped singing. But her mom said, "Lily, you can sing as much as you want. Don't listen to your sister." 

So, Lily started singing again and her mom recorded her. She sounded so beautiful! Lily was happy and her sister even started dancing along. From that day on, Lily sang and danced whenever she wanted, and her mom recorded her every time.

Once upon a time, there was a little boy named Timmy. Timmy loved to eat candy, especially lollipops. One day, Timmy went to the candy store to buy a lollipop. He picked a red one and twisted it in his hand. 

As he walked home, Timmy saw a big, gloomy cloud in the sky. It made him sad. Suddenly, he heard a voice behind him. "That's a yummy lollipop you have there," the voice said. It was his friend, Sally. 

Timmy offered Sally a taste of his lollipop. "It's cherry flavor," he said. Sally took a lick and smiled. "Yum! Thanks, Timmy!" she said. They walked home together, sharing the lollipop and chatting about their day. When they got home, Timmy felt a little less gloomy. He was glad he had shared his candy with his friend.

Once upon a time, there was a little girl named Lily. She loved to eat oysters, but they were very expensive. One day, Lily's mommy said she could pay for one oyster if she did her chores. Lily was very happy and worked very hard to earn the money.

Finally, Lily had enough money to buy her favorite oyster. She went to the store and bought it. But on the way home, she dropped it and it broke. Lily was very sad. She had paid for the oyster, but she didn't get to eat it. 

Lily looked up at the sky and saw a distant cloud. She wished she could go there and forget about her broken oyster. Suddenly, she felt better. She realized that sometimes things don't go as planned, but it's okay to be sad and move on.

Once upon a time, there was a boy named Timmy. Timmy had a soft and cozy bathrobe that he loved to wear after his bath. One day, Timmy's mom asked him to help her look for her keys. Timmy was very helpful and looked everywhere for the keys. He checked under the bed, behind the couch and even in the fridge! Finally, Timmy found the keys on the kitchen counter. His mom was so happy and gave him a big hug. Timmy felt proud and happy that he was able to be helpful. He went to put on his bathrobe and snuggled up on the couch with his mom. The end.

Once upon a time, there was a little bird named Tweetie. Tweetie loved to fly and explore new places. One day, she decided to visit her friend who lived far away. She went to the airport to catch a flight.

At the airport, Tweetie saw a little girl who was lost and crying. Tweetie cared about the little girl and wanted to help her. She flew to the girl and chirped to get her attention. The little girl saw Tweetie and smiled. Tweetie flew around the airport until she found the girl's parents. They were so grateful and thanked Tweetie.

Tweetie realized that helping someone in need was easy and made her feel good. She continued her journey to visit her friend, but she felt happy knowing that she made a difference in someone's life.

Once upon a time, there was a big family. They loved to play and laugh together. One day, they went on a picnic. The sun was shining and the birds were singing. The family brought a special drink to share. It was called lemonade. The lemonade tasted unique, like nothing they had ever tried before. They all drank it and smiled. They were happy to be together as a family.

Once upon a time, there was a big lion who lived in the jungle. He had a very loud voice and he loved to roar. One day, he lost his way and got lost in the forest. He was scared and felt helpless. 

Luckily, a little girl found him and she had a folder with her. She saw the lion and felt sorry for him. She took out a picture of a jungle from her folder and showed it to the lion. The lion recognized the jungle and followed the little girl. 

The little girl led the lion back to his home in the jungle. The lion was very happy and he roared with joy. The little girl felt proud that she was able to help the helpless lion. From that day on, the lion and the little girl became good friends and they often played together in the jungle.

Once upon a time, there was a little girl named Lily. She loved to take pictures with her camera. One day, Lily and her friend Jack went to the park to take pictures of the flowers and trees. Jack had a hairy dog named Max who liked to run around.

As they were taking pictures, Jack said to Lily, "I wish Max didn't have so much hair. It's hard to keep him clean." Lily replied, "Maybe we can design a special camera that takes pictures of Max without showing his hair." Jack thought it was a great idea and they started to draw pictures of their camera.

After a while, they finished designing their camera and took pictures of Max. The camera worked perfectly and Max looked so cute without his hairy fur. They showed the pictures to Max's owner who was amazed. From that day on, Lily and Jack became famous for their special camera design.

Once upon a time, there was a big park with a lot of benches. One of the benches was orange and it was very pretty. One day, a little girl came to the park with her mommy. She wanted to sit on the orange bench, but it was too high for her. So, her mommy helped her raise up onto the bench.

The little girl was very happy to be sitting on the orange bench. She looked around and saw all the other benches in the park. Some were green and some were brown, but the orange bench was her favorite. She asked her mommy if they could come back to the park and sit on the orange bench again.

From that day on, the little girl and her mommy came to the park every week. They always sat on the orange bench and talked about all the fun things they did during the week. The little girl loved the orange bench so much that she even painted a picture of it and hung it on her bedroom wall.

Once upon a time, there was a little girl named Lily. She loved playing in her backyard. It was a beautiful place with green grass and colorful flowers. 

One day, Lily's mommy told her that they were going to have a special surprise in the backyard. Lily was very excited and couldn't wait to find out what it was. 

When they got to the backyard, Lily saw a big, shiny new swing set. She was so happy and decided that she would spend all day playing on it. 

As the day went on, Lily realized that the swing set was not just a fun toy, but it also helped her exercise and stay healthy. She was happy that her mommy had decided to surprise her with such a wonderful gift. From then on, Lily spent every day playing in her beautiful backyard with her new swing set.

Once upon a time, there was a group of animals. They were all friends and loved to play together. One day, they found a big stick that was clear and shiny. They all wanted to play with it, but they didn't know what to do. Then, the clever monkey had an idea. He said, "Let's twist the stick and see what happens!" So, they all took turns twisting the stick, and it made a funny noise. They laughed and played with the stick all day long. The end.

Once upon a time, there was a little girl named Lily. She loved to play with her toys and cuddle with her teddy bear. One day, her mommy gave her a shiny gold coin. Lily thought it was pretty and put it in her piggy bank. She knew it was special because it had a picture of a queen on it. 

Lily's big brother, Max, saw the coin and wanted it for himself. He tried to take it from her, but Lily held on tight. She knew the coin was valuable and didn't want to let it go. Max got angry and called Lily weak because she wouldn't give him the coin. 

Lily didn't care what Max said. She knew the coin was a symbol of something important and she was proud to have it. She kept it safe in her piggy bank and looked at it every day. And even though Max tried to take it, Lily knew its value and wouldn't let anyone else have it.

Once upon a time, there were two friends named Timmy and Tommy. They both loved to play the trumpet and they were very good at it. They practiced every day and they loved to compete with each other to see who was the best.

One day, they got into a big fight because they both wanted to play the trumpet at the same time. They were so competitive that they didn't want to share the trumpet. They were both very angry and they didn't talk to each other for a long time.

But then, they realized that it was better to share the trumpet and play together than to fight and be separate. They learned that being friends was more important than being competitive. From that day on, they played the trumpet together and they were very happy. The moral of the story is that it's better to share and be friends than to be competitive and separate.

Once upon a time, there was a little girl named Lily. She loved to play dress-up and wear different clothes. One day, Lily's mom brought her a new dress. It was a pretty pink color and had flowers on it. Lily loved it and put it on right away.

Lily's friend, Tommy, came over to play. He saw Lily's new dress and said, "Wow, that's a cool fashion!" Lily was happy that Tommy liked her dress. They played together for a while, but then Lily accidentally spilled juice on her dress. She was sad because she thought her dress was ruined.

Tommy said, "Don't worry, Lily. Let's reverse the dress and wear it backwards. Then the juice stain will be in the back and no one will see it!" Lily thought that was a great idea and they both laughed. Lily realized that sometimes doing things different can be fun too.

Once upon a time, there was a boy named Timmy. Timmy loved to eat spaghetti with sauce. He always asked his mom to make him spaghetti with sauce for dinner.

One day, Timmy's mom made him spaghetti with an unknown sauce. Timmy didn't know what it was, but he ate it anyway. As he ate, he noticed that the sauce didn't taste very good. He didn't like it at all.

Timmy's mom told him to listen to his body and stop eating if he didn't like the sauce. But Timmy didn't listen. He kept eating until he got sick. He had to go to the hospital and the doctors had to give him medicine to make him feel better.

From that day on, Timmy always listened to his body and never ate an unknown sauce again.

Once upon a time, there was a young girl named Lily. She had a pretty dress, but it was dirty. Her mother said, "Lily, you must wash your dress." Lily said, "But I don't want to, I want to play with my friends." Her mother replied, "If you don't wash your dress, it will stay dirty and you won't look nice."

Lily went to play with her friends, but she felt jealous of their clean clothes. She said, "I wish I had a clean dress like you." Her friends said, "You should wash your dress, then it will be clean like ours." 

Lily realized she should listen to her mother and wash her dress. She went home and washed it. When she put it on, she felt happy because it was clean and pretty. Her mother said, "See, now you look nice." Lily learned that it's important to listen to her mother and take care of her things.

Once upon a time, there was a little girl named Lily. She loved to play outside and run around. One day, she was playing with her friends when she fell and hurt her knee. She cried and cried because it hurt so much.

Her mom came over and said, "Oh no, what happened? Let's get you inside and rest your knee." Lily's mom picked her up and carried her inside. She put a treat on the table and said, "Here, have a cookie. It will make you feel better."

Lily took a bite of the cookie and felt a little better, but her knee still hurt. She said to her mom, "I'm not comfortable. My knee still hurts." Her mom said, "I understand. Let's put some ice on it and then you can rest on the couch." Lily nodded and her mom put some ice on her knee. She felt better and soon fell asleep on the couch.

Once upon a time, there was a little frog named Freddy. Freddy loved to hop and play in the pond with his friends. One day, Freddy met a beautiful princess. She said, "Hello, little frog. You are so adorable. Would you like to become a prince?"

Freddy was surprised and excited. "I would love to become a prince!" he replied. The princess smiled and said, "But first, you must do something for me. You must find a golden ball that I have lost in the pond."

Freddy searched and searched and finally found the golden ball. He brought it back to the princess and she was very happy. "You have proven yourself to be a brave and kind frog," she said. "I will turn you into a prince."

Suddenly, Freddy felt a strange sensation in his body. He started to grow and change until he became a handsome prince. The princess was amazed and said, "You are now the most handsome prince in all the land." Freddy was overjoyed and said, "Thank you, princess. I will always remember this day." And they lived happily ever after.

Once upon a time, there was a happy sunflower in a big garden. The sunflower was very tall and bright. It loved to feel the sun on its face and the wind in its leaves. One day, a little girl came to the garden and picked the sunflower. She took it home and put it on a scale to weigh it. The sunflower was very heavy and the little girl was happy to have it.

But the next day, the sunflower started to wilt and its petals fell off. The little girl didn't know what to do and felt very sad. She realized that she shouldn't have picked the sunflower and taken it away from its home in the garden. She learned that sometimes it's better to leave things where they belong, so they can keep growing and being happy.

Once upon a time, there was a little girl named Lily. She loved to play with her toys, especially her teddy bear. One day, Lily went to the park to play. She saw a butterfly and thought it was beautiful. She wanted to catch it, but her mommy told her not to because it might get hurt.

Lily admired the butterfly from afar and watched it fly away. Suddenly, she heard an alarm. She saw a little boy crying because he lost his toy. Lily remembered how much she loved her own teddy bear, so she went over to the little boy and gave him her teddy bear to make him feel better.

Lily's mommy was proud of her for being kind and sharing her toy. The moral of the story is that it's important to be kind and help others when they need it.

Once upon a time, there was a huge mill in a small town. Many people worked in the mill. One day, a little girl named Sally went to the mill with her mom. Sally's mom worked at the mill, and Sally wanted to see what her mom did every day.

When they got to the mill, Sally saw a big, scary machine. It made a loud noise that scared her. She started to cry. Her mom said, "Don't be scared, Sally. I will comfort you." Sally's mom held her tight and made her feel better.

Later, Sally saw a small cat stuck near the scary machine. The cat was scared too. Sally remembered how her mom comforted her, so she went to the cat and said, "Don't be scared, little cat. I will comfort you." Sally held the cat tight and made it feel better. The cat was happy, and so was Sally. From that day on, Sally and the cat were best friends, and they both learned that a little comfort can make a big difference.

Once upon a time, there was a friendly gorilla named Gigi. Gigi lived in a big forest with her friends. She liked to play with her friends and eat yummy food. One day, Gigi found a big ice cream cone on the ground. She was very happy and excited.

Gigi picked up the ice cream cone and said, "I will share this with my friends!" She walked around the forest to find her friends, but the sun was very hot. Gigi felt the ice cream start to melt in her hand. She knew she had to hurry to share it with her friends.

Gigi found her friends and said, "Look what I found! Let's share this ice cream!" But when she opened her hand, the ice cream had melted away. All that was left was a sticky mess. Gigi and her friends were sad that they couldn't eat the ice cream. They learned that sometimes, things don't go the way we want them to.

One day, a little girl named Amy found a mint on the floor. She picked it up and looked at it. It was green and round. Amy thought it looked yummy. She wanted to show it to her friend, Tom.

Amy ran to Tom and said, "Look what I found! It's a mint!" Tom looked at the mint and said, "Ew, that looks disgusting! It's dirty from the floor!" Amy looked at the mint again and saw that it was dirty. She felt sad.

Amy and Tom decided to clean the mint. They took it to the sink and washed it with water. Then, they spun it around in a towel to dry it off. The mint was clean and shiny now.

Tom looked at the mint and said, "Now it looks good! Let's share it!" Amy smiled and broke the mint in half. They each ate a piece. The mint was sweet and tasty. They were happy they cleaned the mint and shared it together.

One day, a little girl named Sue went to the park with her mom. They saw a big, black box on the ground. Sue was curious and asked her mom, "What is that?"

Her mom said, "It's a box, Sue. Let's open it and see what's inside." They opened the black box and found lots of popcorn inside! Sue and her mom were very happy.

They decided to sit on the grass and eat the popcorn. As they ate, they watched the birds and the clouds in the sky. Sue said, "I love popcorn and I love this day!" Her mom smiled and hugged her. They had a great time together at the park.

One day, a cop was walking down the street. He saw a boy with a crazy hat. The boy was sad because he lost his seat. The cop wanted to help the boy find his seat.

The cop asked, "What does your seat look like?" The boy said, "It is red and small." So, they looked for the red and small seat. They looked under a big tree and behind a blue car. Then, they found the seat next to a green house.

The boy was very happy to find his seat. He thanked the cop and they became good friends. They sat on the seat and talked about their day. The cop and the boy with the crazy hat had a fun day together.

One day, a little girl named Mia found a box of matches. She knew they were for making fire, but she didn't know how to use them. She wanted to attach the matches to her toy car, so it could go faster. Mia asked her big brother, Tom, for help.

"Tom, can you help me attach these matches to my car?" Mia asked. Tom was a reliable big brother, and he always helped Mia when she needed it.

"Sure, Mia," Tom said. "But we need to be careful with matches. They can be dangerous." Tom showed Mia how to attach the matches to her toy car safely, so they wouldn't make a fire.

Mia was so happy that her car looked faster now. She played with her car and the matches all day, and Tom stayed with her to make sure she was safe. They had lots of fun together, and Mia knew she could always count on her reliable big brother, Tom.

Once upon a time, there was a little dog named Spot. Spot was a calm dog who liked to sit on his stand and watch the birds fly by. One day, Spot saw a big tree and birds were singing in it. He decided to go near the tree and listen to the birds.

As Spot walked to the tree, he met a cat named Whiskers. Whiskers was sitting under the tree and looking up at the birds. Spot said, "Hi Whiskers, do you like the birds too?" Whiskers looked at him and said, "Yes, Spot. I love to watch them sing and play."

Spot and Whiskers decided to sit under the tree together and listen to the birds. They were both very calm and happy. The birds saw them and sang even louder. Spot and Whiskers became good friends and they always met under the tree to enjoy the birds' songs.

Once upon a time, in a small forest, there was a unique frog named Lily. Lily was not like the other frogs. She had a very pretty color and a special gift. She could tell if something was poison or not.

One day, Lily saw a big, red fruit. She knew that this fruit was poison. She told all her friends in the forest, "Do not eat this fruit. It is poison." But some of the animals did not listen to Lily.

A little rabbit named Timmy did not believe Lily. He thought she was telling a lie. So, Timmy ate the red fruit. Soon, he felt very sick. Lily and the other animals helped Timmy get better.

After that day, all the animals in the forest learned to listen to Lily. They knew she was not telling a lie. They also learned to be careful of poison. The moral of the story is: always listen to those who know more than you and do not think they are lying.

One day, a little girl named Lucy wanted to play hide and seek with her dog, Max. She looked around the house to find a good place to hide. She saw a big closet and thought it would be a great spot.
