But then the silly little girl put on her best frown and shouted â€œI know what to do!â€ She hopped out of bed and headed straight towards the alarm. She grabbed it with both hands and shook it until it stopped making noise. Everyone cheered at her brave act, and even the alarm seemed to smile. 

The little girl was proud of her accomplishment and she had a huge smile on her face. From that day forward, no one ever had to worry about the rare alarm again. 

The End.

One day, a very strong stream was flowing through the forest. The trees and the animals all enjoyed watching it go by. But the stream was getting stronger and stronger, and soon it became too powerful to stay in the same place.

So it started to move onwards, taking a journey through the forest. Everywhere it went, it picked up bits of dirt and leaves, becoming bigger and bigger.

The stream eventually reached a big lake, and when it got there, it made a big splash as it became part of the lake. Everyone who was there was happy to see that the stream was finally at its new home. They all smiled as the stream became part of the lake, and the strong stream now had a place to stay.

There was a young boy who didn't always do what his parents asked him. One day, he decided to ignore an important request. This made his parents angry and they needed to punish him.

The boy's parents sat him down and explained why it was important to follow their instructions. They also told him that not listening was not acceptable behavior. 

The boy was very sad and he knew he had made a mistake. He apologized and promised he would never do it again. His parents knew he was sorry and they hugged him. 

Then they explained the punishment: He had to miss out on the fun activity he had planned for that day. He had to stay inside and do some chores.

The boy was sad, but he accepted the punishment. He knew it was an important lesson. From that day on, he was a much more respectful youth. He listened carefully to the instructions his parents gave him.

Once upon a time a man was walking through the woods. He had been warned to be careful becasue he was close to a big pit. As he walked he saw a reliable animal in the thicket. It was a furry, brown bear.

The man was scared but the bear didn't seem to notice him. He stood motionless and the bear just stared at him. It was still and its face was soft. The man was relieved and kept walking through the woods. He remembered the warning and kept away from the pit.

He eventually made it through the woods safely and looked back on what had happened. He was happy he had trusted his instinct and listened to the warning. It had kept him away from the pit and made him feel safe.

The man was so thankful to be reliable and cautious. He went home happy and well. The end.

One day, Mary went to the store to pick some juice. She saw lots of different kinds of juice but she chose the apple juice. She grabbed a bottle and went to the check-out. The cashier was very friendly and calm.

After Mary left the store, she went home. There, she opened the bottle and took a sip. The juice was delicious! She smiled and drank some more.

When she finished the juice, she put the bottle in the sink. Then she washed her hands and went to her room to watch her favorite show. It was so nice and calm.

The next day, Mary went to the store again. She was excited to pick some more juice.

The small baby was in her seat, looking around the room. She looked to her left and saw a brain, blue and purple. She smiled and waved hello. Then she looked to her right and saw a small rabbit with big eyes. It hopped away and the baby laughed.

Then the baby grabbed her toy and put it on her small seat. She made it spin around and around. She laughed with joy. Then the baby moved her seat a bit closer to the brain. She reached out her hand and poked it. It felt soft to her touch.

The baby played for a while until it was time to go home. She said goodbye to the brain and hopped away in her seat. As she left, the brain smiled and waved goodbye. The baby smiled and waved back.

Once upon a time there was a beautiful reef in the ocean. The reef was filled with colorful fish and bright corals. The coral was so beautiful that everyone wanted to receive it! 

But the reef was far away, and not everyone was able to get there. This made it difficult for those who wanted to receive the coral.

Then one day, something amazing happened. A ship arrived carrying a very special cargo - the reef! It was now available to everyone who wanted it. 

The people were so excited! They quickly packed up the reef and brought it back to their homes. They enjoyed the colors and the beauty of the reef. 

From that day onwards, the reef was freely available to those who wanted to receive it. All because of the special cargo ship! 


The End.

John was walking through the park, and he was starting to shiver. He was wearing a cheap sweater, so it wasn't keeping him very warm. He saw a pear tree and he decided to have a look. There were lots of pears growing on the tree, and they looked delicious. John picked the biggest pear he could find. It felt soft and smooth in his hands, and he was happy. He took a bite of the pear and it was so sweet and juicy! John suddenly stopped shivering, he was feeling much warmer. He was so pleased with his cheap find! John finished the pear and went home with a big smile on his face.

Once there was a little boy who was very brave. He loved to play make believe and pretend that he was the strongest. One day the little boy was feeling especially brave so he decided to venture out into the forest.

The forest was dark and mysterious, but the brave little boy was fearless. He soon came across a huge beast. At first he was scared, but he soon realised it was just sleeping. Its belly was growling and it was hungry. 

The little boy thought he could help so he started to feed the beast. He scooped up some food from a nearby pond and put it in its mouth. The beast ate the food and smiled. 

The little boy was so proud of himself and was rewarded with a trophy. It was a shiny golden medal and he was beaming from ear to ear. The brave little boy had conquered his fear and earned himself a trophy.

Once there was a healthy boy. He was big and strong and liked to play. One day he wanted to play catch, but he didn't have a ball. He asked around, but no one had one to lend.

The boy thought about it for a minute, then he had an idea. He ran to his neighbor's house and knocked on the door. Luckily, the neighbor had a ball to lend. She gave it to the boy and he thanked her very much.

Now the boy could play catch. He ran outside with his new ball, full of excitement. He invited all the kids in his neighborhood to join him. Everyone had so much fun playing catch and being healthy.

The boy was very thankful that his neighbor had been kind enough to lend him the ball. He made sure to thank her many times. Everywhere he went, he always found someone to lend him a ball so he could keep playing and staying healthy.

Once upon a time, there was a girl called Rose. Rose believed in magical things like fairies and dragons.

One day, Rose found a hidden cave. It had a big, dark sink inside. At first, Rose was a bit scared, but then she decided to believe that the sink could be magical.

Rose went to get a special stone that she thought would help her. She closed her eyes and held the stone tight while she wished out loud. Suddenly, the sink started to bubble and sparkle!

Rose opened her eyes and saw that the sink had filled up with bright, glittery water. She put her hand inside, and it felt warm and friendly.

Rose stayed in the hidden cave for a while, playing with her magical sink. Whenever she felt sad, she would go and make a wish in her special sink. With just a little bit of belief, Rose's wishes always seemed to come true. 

The End.

Once there was a little girl named Jane. She liked to sell things. One day she had a good idea. She decided to sell the heat from the sun!

Jane went outside and sat in the sun. It was quiet. The heat was so pleasant. Jane decided to sell it.

She began running around the neighbourhood yelling "Heat for sale! Get your heat here!" Everyone was very surprised.

One by one, people started buying the heat from Jane. They put some money in her hands, and Jane gave them some of the heat.

Soon all the heat was gone. Jane was very happy with all the money she made. And she was glad to help make everyone else's day a bit warmer and brighter.

Once upon a time, there were two friends, Jeff and Lucy. They trusted each other so much that they could tell each other anything. One day, Lucy had a lot of trouble at her house and she was very sad. Jeff could see it in her eyes. He knew he had to help.

Without saying a word, Jeff gave Lucy a big hug and told her that everything would be ok. He knew it was the only way he could make her feel better.

The next day, Jeff took Lucy on a long walk to help her forget her trouble. He showed her all sorts of beautiful flowers and five little birds that were playing in the tree. Lucy smiled again. 

Jeff was glad he had made Lucy happy. He knew that if they trusted each other, they could get through anything, no matter how long it takes. 

The End

Tommy had an idea. He wanted to scatter petals around his mum and dad's bedroom. It would be a surprise for them when they got up in the morning. 

Tommy gathered the petals from the garden and put them in a basket. then he scampered into his mum and dad's bedroom. It was easy to scatter the petals around the room. Tommy worked quickly, making sure every corner of the room was full of petals. 

When Tommy was done, he smiled and admired his handiwork. Then he scampered out and hid under the bed.

In the morning, his mum and dad were surprised by the beautiful petals in the room. They smiled and hugged Tommy, thanking him for the lovely surprise. 

Tommy had just proven that even a simple idea can make someone feel loved.

Sally loved taking walks on the beach. Today, the waves were whispering softly against the sand and the sun was shining brightly. She could feel the warmth of the sun on her face and she felt so happy.

She decided to pick up a new shell that she could keep as a special reminder of this day. When she bent down to pick it up, the waves seemed to whisper her name. Sally smiled and waved her hand in the air.

Suddenly, Sally heard the most wonderful sound! It was the sound of a new baby bird singing its first song. It was so beautiful that Sally started to cry. She wanted to tell the little bird how happy it made her feel, so she started to whisper encouraging words to it. The baby bird answered by singing one little tweet. A new friendship had started and it made them both feel very happy.

Once upon a time there was a boy. He went for a walk in the park and he saw a tree. He wanted to climb it, but it was so high! He was a brave boy, so he tried. He put his feet on the bark and climbed, and climbed, and climbed. Suddenly, the tree began to snap! The boy jumped off quickly, and he heard a loud noise behind him. The tree had fallen over and landed in a puddle! The boy was not hurt, but he noticed something else. There was a jar of yummy sauce spilled all over the ground! He knelt down and tasted it, and it was delicious. He took it home with him and ate it with all his meals. The sauce made everything taste so much better and the boy was very happy. He was proud that his brave climb of the high tree had brought him something so special!

Mark was tired, so he snuggled into bed and closed his eyes. He slept for a long time until the sun woke him up. Mark was ashamed because he had slept so late. But he felt rested and happy and ready to start the day.

Mark ate his breakfast, then went outside to play. He laughed and jumped and sang.

Soon, it was afternoon and the sun was high in the sky. Mark was tired again so he laid down for a nap. He fell asleep quickly and slept for a few hours. When he woke up, he felt refreshed and energised.

Mark was no longer ashamed for sleeping late. A good sleep makes everything better!

Once there was a mum and her little girl. The mum always took care of her little girl and tried to make her comfortable. The mum would keep her little girl warm and safe. She would hug her and tell her stories. 

The mum took special care of her little girl's skin. She would make sure it was clean and healthy. She put a protective cream on her little girl's skin to make sure it was comfortable.

The little girl always felt so safe with her mum's care. She was so happy and grateful that her mum looked after her so well. The mum and the little girl loved each other very much.

Once upon a time, there was a little girl. She found a frame on the ground, and it was very pretty. She picked it up, and she looked inside. Inside the frame was something disgusting - a slimy green goo! 

The goo started to move and grow bigger. Soon, the goo had become a monster! It had big eyes and eight little legs. The monster was so scary, but the little girl wasn't afraid.

The monster started to talk to the little girl. He said he was lonely and he wanted to find a friend. The little girl was so happy to help him, and they became friends.

The little girl brought the monster home. Her mum was so surprised when she saw the monster, but she smiled and said it was okay. From then on, the monster and the little girl were the best of friends.

Once upon a time there was a famous train. Every day it would go around the rails, but one day it couldn't finish its journey. It got stuck in the middle of the rail and no one knew what to do.

The train workers tried their hardest to help the train, but it still wouldn't move. Everyone felt stuck and they wondered what they could do.

Then, suddenly a bright idea came to one of the train workers. They got a big group of children to help. The children pushed with all their might and soon the train was able to finish its journey.

The train was so happy and the children were proud of what they had done. From then on, the famous train was forever thankful to the children and their bright idea.

Once upon a time, there was a country. It was far away and difficult to reach. Everyone in the country was very brave. They never wanted to surrender.

One day, a giant monster attacked the country. It was so very big and strong! No one in the country knew how to fight it. They were scared and decided to surrender.

Suddenly, a magical creature arrived to help the country. It breathed magical fire from its mouth.  The monster was afraid of the magical fire and ran away.

Everyone in the country was very relieved. They cheered for the magical creature and thanked it for saving them. They knew that if the magical creature had not arrived, they would have had to surrender.

One day, Jack jumped on his trampoline in the garden. He was so happy! He laughed as he jumped high and far. He shouted, "Look how high I can reach!" 

Suddenly, the trampoline got caught on a branch of a nearby tree. Even though Jack tried to pull it free, it wouldn't budge. He felt so guilty as he looked around for someone to help. 

Just then, his older brother popped outside and said, "I'll help you with that". Jack felt much better. His brother wound back his arm and used all his might to pull the trampoline free. 

After a few pulls, the trampoline suddenly flew out and Jack flew with it! He sailed across the garden and came to a stop in front of a big pile of leaves. He rolled around in the leaves and felt so excited - it was like a big pile of springs! 

Jack was so happy! He had reached his goal of jumping on the trampoline and playing in the leaves. What a great day!

Andy and Emma were two best friends. They were always doing fun things together. One day, they decided to have a race. They grabbed their old camera so they could take pictures of their race.

 Emma got to the finish line first. Andy tried to catch up, but he was too slow. He giggled as he watched Emma reach the wall first.

They looked at the pictures on the old camera. They laughed at the silly poses they made as they raced. Andy and Emma had so much fun racing together and taking pictures that they decided to do it again!

Ollie was a very happy 3 year old boy. He went for a walk in the park one day and saw a big, beautiful tree. Ollie was so excited and he ran to it with a big smile on his face. He hugged the tree and said "I love you tree!".

As he hugged the tree, he felt like the tree was hugging him back. He stopped and thought to himself, "This tree must love me, too!". So Ollie hugged the tree and played around it for the entire afternoon.

But, one night, there was a big storm. Wind blew fiercely and thunder crashed loudly. Ollie knew his tree was in danger and he was so scared for it. He knew he had to help, so he ran to it and held it tightly to stop it from being blown away. But the tree was weak and the wind was too strong. Ollie hugged the tree tight as he felt it slowly being pulled away from him.

Finally, the wind stopped and the Tree was still there! Ollie was so relieved and hugged the tree again and said, "I love you, tree!". He knew he could always count on the tree to stay with him no matter what and that they would always love each other.

Mum was in the kitchen, making dinner. It looked modern, with shiny surfaces and many gadgets. Mum was always in the kitchen and she looked very busy, rushing around.

One day she noticed that something was missing. She had a big lock on the door, and she couldn't open it. She kept pushing the button, but it wouldn't open.

Mum asked her little daughter for help. The girl knew what to do, so she stepped forward and put her hand on the lock. She smiled, moved the handle and it opened.

Mum was amazed. They went inside and the kitchen was exactly the same. It was just as modern - only now it had a lock. Mum was so happy to have something to keep the kitchen safe. 

The little girl smiled, proud that she had locked the kitchen.

Once upon a time there was a little girl called Emma. She was three years old. Emma went to the park with her mom and dad. They brought some food for her to eat. 

When Emma sat down, she saw a small bird. She was excited to see it and wanted to get closer to it. She slowly walked to the bird and then it flew away. 

Emma was a bit worried. She guessed the bird didnâ€™t want her to be close. But then the bird returned with some food. It put the food near Emmaâ€™s feet. 

Emma was very happy! She started to eat the food and the bird stayed with her. They ate the food together and then the bird flew away. Emma waved goodbye to the bird as it left. 

Emma smiled. She was no longer worried and was very happy to have met the bird.

Once there was a little boy. He was walking in the park. The sun was shining and he was having fun. But then, he heard a noise. It was a freezing cold noise. 

He ran to find out what it was and he saw a puppy. The puppy was all alone and it was shaking. The little boy felt very upset.

He knew he had to help. He picked up the puppy and brought it home. When he got home, he gave it a warm blanket and some food. 

The puppy felt much better and the little boy was happy. Then they went back to the park together. But they had to stop when it got dark. 

The little boy said goodbye to the puppy and went home. He was happy he had made the puppy feel better.

Once upon a time there was a green top. The green top glowed in the dark. It was so shiny and sparkly. Everyone wanted to have the green top.

One day, a little girl saw the green top. She was so happy and she wanted to keep it. She asked her mom if she could have the green top and her mom said yes.

The little girl kept the green top in her bedroom. Every night when it was dark, the green top glowed so brightly. It lit up her bedroom and she was never scared in the dark.

The little girl and the green top were best friends and they played together every day. The green top glowed and it was the best top in the whole world!

One day, Daisy was feeling lonely. She didn't have anyone to play with, but she looked at the sky and saw a wonderful sunrise. Suddenly, a magical sparkle flew from the sky and landed in front of her. It was a sparkle fairy! 

The sparkle fairy said she was lost and needed help. Daisy said she would rescue her. Daisy used her hand to carefully pick up the sparkle fairy and took her to a safe place. 

The sparkle fairy thanked Daisy with a happy smile and flew away. Daisy waved goodbye and watched until the sparkle fairy had disappeared into the sky.

As Daisy looked back at the beautiful sunrise, she felt proud of herself for rescuing the sparkle fairy. She knew that she had made a difference and hadn't been so lonely after all.

One day, Jack and Mommy went to the park. Jack was very enthusiastic to play. He noticed a large squash lying in the grass. Quickly, Jack ran over and picked it up. Mommy was so excited and asked to play a game. She proposed to tie a string between two trees, and to toss the squash back and forth. 

Jack happily agreed and they started the game. At first, it was a bit tricky for both of them to get the squash to the other, but after a few tries, Jack was a pro. He laughed and cheered as he ran back and forth to get the squash. 

Mommy and Jack played until the sun started to go down. Then, Jack tied the string back to the trees, and the two of them ran home. It was an fun adventure for both of them.

Once upon a time there was a wild cat. He was wandering through the woods looking for a place he could call home. As he was looking, he passed by a clearing. There, on the floor was a strange box. The wild cat decided to take a closer look. The cat hopped in and found it was the perfect place for him to belong.

The wild cat curled up inside and fell asleep. After a while, a little girl spotted the cat in the box. She waved her hands and danced around, she was so excited. She wanted to take the cat, she knew he belonged with her. The cat meowed and said yes, so she carefully took him home.

Once home, the little girl chose for the cat a special place. It was a soft, fluffy rug on the floor. She knew it would be the perfect place for the cat to nap and play. The cat moved in right away and was so happy, he even jumped and purred to show he was happy he belonged. 

From that day on, the wild cat felt like he belonged with the little girl and her family. He found his true home and he was very happy.

Max was very sad. He was sitting in his room and feeling lonely. Then he saw a door in the corner that he had never seen before. He got up and opened the door. Inside was a dark and scary attic. He was scared but he was also curious. He slowly moved up the stairs until he reached the attic. He heard a noise and he saw a mouse jumping around the room. Max was so excited! He laughed and jumped around the attic with the mouse. They played together until he couldn't stay any longer. Max was sad to leave the attic but he was so happy that he had made a new friend.

Once upon a time, there was a little girl named Lucy. She was very excited because her family had decided to decorate their house for the upcoming holiday. Her mom and dad had gone to the store to get decorations to make their house look festive.

When they returned home, Lucy was happy to help them put up the decorations. They put up Christmas lights that lit up the room, and she even helped to hang the Christmas stockings.

Once they were finished, they had a feast to celebrate. Everyone at the table was happy, but then Lucy's dad surprised them by saying he had a special lecture to give. All of a sudden, Lucy was very upset. She didn't like lectures and thought they were boring.

But then her dad began to speak. He said that decorating was not only about making things look nice, but about taking time to appreciate the joy and love in our lives. Everyone was happy again at the end of the lecture, and Lucy realized that her dad was right. Decorating can be lots of fun after all!

Once there was a duck who wanted to fly. But the duck had no feathers! The duck felt very upset because all the other birds could fly and he couldn't. 

The duck looked all around for feathers, but he could not find any. He asked other animals but they all said no. "Please," said the duck. "I really need feathers."

Finally, a nice owl said he had some feathers that the little duck could have. The owl gave the feathers to the duck and the duck was so happy! He thanked the owl and put the feathers on his wings. 

Now the duck could fly! He flew high in the sky, happy because he finally had feathers. He never felt so free!

Once there was a girl. She liked to throw things. She especially liked to throw rocks into the gray sink. 

Sometimes she would throw two rocks at once. They made a big splash in the sink. But she was careful not to throw too many rocks.

She also liked to make a game out of it. She would try to get the rock to bounce off the sink and back into her hands. But it was tricky and some of the rocks went down the drain.

But that was okay. It was fun to just keep throwing the rocks. Plus it felt nice to feel the splash on her face when she threw them. 

So she kept throwing rocks into the sink. She liked to see how many she could fit in without it getting too full.

Once upon a time, there were two young sheep playing in a field. One was named Dave and the other was named Tina. The sun was shining and the grass was bright green.

Suddenly, Dave let out a loud scream! Tina looked around and saw a giant bear. She was scared and started to run away. Dave was so scared that he ran too. They ran and ran until they were out of the field. 

Tina was so tired that she collapsed on the ground. Dave came over to make sure she was ok. He said, â€œLetâ€™s never go back there again!â€ 

Tina agreed and said, â€œNever!â€ Then they both smiled and went off to find a new place to play without any bears. They were happy and never forgot the scary bear!

Once there was a family who liked to go for walks. Whenever they went for a walk, the staff would help them by carrying their bags. 

One day, the family went for a walk, but something was wrong. The staff seemed very sad. The family asked what was wrong, but the staff could not say. 

The family asked the staff to stop and take a break. The staff was very happy and thanked the family for being so kind. 

The family gave the staff some cookies and a drink. After a few minutes, the staff was feeling better. The family was so happy to see the staff smile again. 

The family offered to help the staff more often when they went on their walks. The staff was so thankful and said they would be happy to have the familyâ€™s help. 

From then on, whenever the family went for a walk, they were sure to help the staff so they could both enjoy their time together.

Once upon a time, there was a happy girl who liked to take naps. Every day she would take a nap in her room. But one day something special happened. As the girl was taking her nap there was a loud whistle outside her window. She woke up and decided to go outside to see what it was. 

She ran outside and saw a big yellow truck coming down the street. She was so excited! Every time the truck stopped, it would make a loud whistle. When the truck stopped in front of her house, two friendly people got out. They were bringing a big surprise for the girl. 

The girl was so excited! It was a huge playground in her very own backyard. The girl's face lit up with joy and she couldn't believe her eyes. She thanked the people who had brought the playground and spent the rest of the day playing on it. When it was time for bed, the girl was so tired and happy that she fell asleep quickly. 

The end.

One day, two little girls were playing in the park. They had a banana with them. They were being careless and dropped it on the ground. They looked at the banana sadly. They wanted to eat it but it wasn't okay anymore.

Suddenly, someone special arrived. It was their Mommy! She saw the banana and realized what had happened. She was wonderful and managed to make it better. She peeled the banana and then cut it into pieces. Now it looked yummy.

The two little girls were delighted. They ate the banana pieces, being careful not to drop any. They were so happy that their Mommy was able to manage the situation. She was the best Mommy in the world!

Once upon a time there was a big house with an attic. Daddy said it was time to move some of the things into the attic so they could provide more space to play. 

Mummy and Daddy took big boxes up the stairs and into the attic. They put old toys, clothes and chairs in the boxes and made them all neat. Then they went back downstairs. 

Mummy said the attic was flexible now they had put lots of things in there. Daddy said it was great because now they had lots of space to play. 

Every now and then if Mummy and Daddy needed something from the attic, they would go up the stairs to get it. But most of the time the attic was left alone. 

And the family was very happy because they had lots of space and the attic was very flexible. The End.

There was a successful painter. He liked to paint beautiful pictures. One day he decided to go outside to paint with rain. He mixed the rain with his paint. It made the colours pop. He painted and painted in the rain. He was so happy with the results! He painted the most beautiful pictures the world has ever seen. Everyone loved his work. He was a very successful painter!

Once upon a time, in a far off land there lived a Queen. The Queen was a kind Queen who always looked out for the people of her kingdom.

One day, the Queen heard a loud noise coming from the nearby forest and she panic. She ran to see what the noise was, but it was so dark and dangerous. She slowly crept through the forest, but then she heard a roar.

The Queen screamed and ran. She frantically searched for a way to get away from the scary sound. She soon stumbled upon a hole in the ground. She jumped in and it was deep and dark. The Queen found that she was safe and sound.

The Queen stayed there until morning, when it was safe to go outside. When she finally emerged the Queen thanked the stars that she was safe. Then she hurried home and told her people to be careful when they go near the forest.

Once upon a time there was a jolly man who loved his job. Every day he did the same task and it made him smile. One day though, the man panicked when something went wrong at his job. He did not know what to do and he started to worry. He sailed his boat around the sea looking for help.

Eventually, the jolly man saw a big castle filled with friendly people. He asked for help and the people kindly helped him with his problem. The man thanked them and said goodbye. He was feeling much better and soon he was back to his jolly self.

The man sailed back home feeling relieved. He knew from then on he would never panic if something went wrong at his job again. He had learnt that help was always near. And he was happy to have his jolly job back.

Once upon a time there was a bad thief. He wanted to take all the good things. All the nice people were scared.

One day, two friends came by. They had special powers, and were very brave. They wanted to help everyone, so they worked together to restore things back to the way they were.

The friends used their powers to make the thief leave. He was never seen again. Everyone thanked the friends and was happy to have their good things back.

The friends had made the town safe again. They were proud of what they had done, and everyone was grateful.

One day, a mommy and her daughter went out for a walk. They passed a tank, and the daughter asked what it was. The mommy felt regret for not knowing the answer, but she told her daughter it was a big, red car.

After the walk, they stopped at the store. The daughter wanted to buy something spicy. The mommy said no, but she still felt regret for not agreeing.

The mommy and daughter continued on their walk, but eventually they had to say goodbye. The daughter asked to go back to the tank, but the mommy said no. She regretted not taking her daughter back to the tank.

The mommy and daughter said their goodbyes and promised to go back to the tank soon.

Once there was a poor rabbit who lived in a hole in the ground. He had nothing to play with but he was happy anyway.

One day, he heard a noise. What he saw made him very excited! It was a toy, hopping across the grass. The rabbit hopped over to the toy and picked it up. It was a bright yellow ball.

The rabbit was so happy to have the toy. He hopped around the field, pushing the ball all around. He had so much fun playing with his new toy!

At the end of the day, the poor rabbit hopped back to his hole in the ground. But then, something amazing happened. When the rabbit put his toy away, he found lots of other toys waiting for him! He could hardly believe it.

Now, every day the poor rabbit hops around the field playing with his new toys. He is so happy that he has something new to play with.

Once there was an elderly person who loved to take walks in the park. One day, he was taking his regular stroll when he spotted a bird, flying around in the sky. All of a sudden, the bird dived down and bit the elderly person on the arm. It was surprised by what had happened and started to scream. The elderly person ran away, scared of the bird.

Meanwhile, a young three year old boy was playing nearby and saw what had happened. He saw the bird and spoke to it in a soothing voice. He reached out his hand and the bird flew onto it. He held it gently and the bird calmed down. He looked into the eyes of the bird and saw it was scared.

The little boy carefully brought the bird over to the elderly person and showed it to him. He told the elderly person not to be scared. The elderly person looked at the boy and smiled. The bird flew away and the elderly person thanked the little boy for helping him. From that day onward, the boy always kept an eye out for the elderly person when he took his walks in the park.

Sam and his dad were running in the park. Sam loved running because he was very fast. His dad was not as fast, but he tried his best to keep up.

Suddenly, they saw a giant creature stomping between the trees. It was a big and strong dinosaur with thick scales on its back. It roared loudly as it moved.

Sam was scared, and he wanted to run away. His dad told him to be brave and that the dinosaur was just running, speeding through the forest. It was a long way away and it was in no danger of hurting them.

Sam felt brave now, and he smiled. He watched the dinosaur speed away until it was out of sight. He laughed and said, "That was a fun dinosaur!" His dad smiled and agreed with him. They kept running all around the park, until it was time for them to go home.

Amy was in her classroom and it was so beautiful. She wanted to explore and have fun, but it was time for a lesson. Amy felt like she had to resist that. In the classroom, Amy saw lots of interesting things. She wanted to touch them, but her teacher said no. She tried so hard to resist the temptation. After a while, it became easier to follow the rules and Amy had a great time in the classroom. She learned lots of things and shared special moments with her friends. At the end of the day, Amy was so happy she had resisted the temptation and enjoyed her classroom.

Once upon a time there was a girl who liked to play outside. She always picked up sticks and stones and snap them with her hands. One day, she came across something special - a cell! It looked like a regular stone, but when she snapped it in her hands, it made a funny noise. She didn't know what it was, but she knew she wanted it. 

The girl took the cell home and showed it to her mom. Her mom said it was a special kind and showed her how to use it. The girl learned that the cell was a toy and she could snap it in her hands to make different sounds. The girl was so excited to show off her new toy to her friends at school. 

At school, the girl put on a show with her cell. She snapped it with her hands while her friends sang along. Everyone liked it and wanted to have a cell of their own. The girl and her friends had so much fun with their regular cells! They always had something to do at recess and it made the days fly by.

Once upon a time there was a little girl who loved to play. Her mother would always stay, and watch her have fun. One day the little girl wanted to play with a tool from her mother's home. She said, "Mommy, can I borrow the tool please?" Her mother answered with a serious face, "No, no, no! You must not borrow that tool." The little girl looked sad, but she listened to her mother. She understood that she could not borrow the tool, because it was too serious. The mother hugged the girl and said, "You can borrow any of my other tools, they are not so serious!" The little girl smiled, and her mother hugged her again. After that they went outside together, and had lots of fun.

Once upon a time, there was a strong bus. The bus was travelling through the forest when it suddenly got a flat tire. The driver was so sad and the other passengers were getting worried. Suddenly a little boy stepped out of the forest. He was very kind and smiled at everyone. He asked the driver of the bus if he could help. With the little boy's help, the bus soon had a new tire and was ready to go. The driver was so happy, he wanted to thank the little boy. He wanted to give him something special. But the little boy shook his head. He didn't want anything; he was happy just to help. "All I want," he said, "is for you to forgive everyone who ever made a mistake." The driver looked at the little boy and smiled. He thought that was a very kind thing to say. The driver of the bus thanked the little boy again, and the bus drove off into the sunset.

Once upon a time, there was a bird called Gizmo. Gizmo had wings that could fly him high into the sky. He loved to fly whatever the weather. 

One day Gizmo wanted to explore further than usual, so he flapped his wings and flew higher and higher until he saw a big network of wires in the sky. Gizmo was intrigued, but he noticed there was a big sign that said â€œDANGER!â€ He decided to fly closer and have a better look. 

Gizmo soon figured out that the network was a dangerous power line. The wires carried electricity that was very dangerous to touch. Gizmo was glad he had read the sign and been careful. He flew away quickly, before any danger could come his way. 

Back at home, Gizmo told his friends all about the big power line. Everyone was glad that Gizmo had been careful and stayed safe. They all agreed that you should always take notice of signs that might be warning you about something dangerous. And so Gizmo and the other birds lived happy and safe. The end.

Once upon a time there was an ancient year. An old wizard lived in a castle near the mountain. He had a magical pet called Firecat.

One day Firecat decided to explore the mountain. He ran away and got stuck in an old cave. He yowled for help, but no one could hear him.

The old wizard heard Firecat's cries at his castle. He quickly flew to the mountain to rescue Firecat.

The old wizard used his magic to open the door to the cave. Firecat was so happy to see him. He licked his wizard's face in gratitude. 

Together, the wizard and Firecat made their way back home. The old wizard was so proud of his brave pet. Firecat was happy to be safe. They lived happily ever after in the old castle.

Once there was a little puppy named Paw. He was so happy and playful, but his family had to go away and left him alone. He was fearful, so he curled up in a corner of the house and stayed quiet.

One day, a big cat came by and saw the little puppy. It purred and teasingly waved it's paw in front of him. Paw was scared and tried to run away, but the cat wouldn't let him.The cat kept teasing Paw and Paw was becoming more and more scared.

Suddenly, a beautiful butterfly flew past. The cat was distracted and it forgot about Paw. Paw was so relieved and happy. He jumped up and started running around the garden, his fear forgotten. The cat watched him curiously before disappearing into the woods.

Paw was safe and happy again. He ran around and played all day, never forgetting how the cat had teased him.

Today, Timmy had a lot of fun playing in the park. He laughed and ran and ran, chasing after his friends. But now, it was time to return to the house. Timmy slowly dragged his feet to his bedroom, but it was easy to find his way. He knew exactly where he was going.

When he got to his bedroom, he saw a big box, with a bow on top. He ran to the box and opened it. Inside was all kinds of fun stuff, just for him! He jumped and shouted in excitement, then opened all the things he found.

After playing for a while, Timmy was feeling tired. He put the box away and snuggled up in his bed. He felt so sleepy and easy, it didn't take long for him to drift off to dreamland. 

The next morning, Timmy woke up feeling refreshed. He was ready for another day of play at the park, and he couldn't wait to return and have some more fun.

Max was very lonely. He wanted someone to play with but all of his friends were busy.
Max put on his coat and decided to go for a ride on his bike. He pedalled as fast as he could until he reached the park.

When he got there, Max saw a little girl on a swing. He went up to her and said hello. The little girl said hello back and asked if Max wanted to play. Max said yes and the two of them started playing tag.

Max and the little girl had so much fun that they stayed at the park until it was time for a tea break. They both shared a delicious cup of tea and talked until the sun had gone down.

Max said goodbye to the little girl and gave her a big hug. Then he hopped on his bike and rode back home. Max realized he wasn't so lonely anymore.

Once there was a little rock. It was stubborn and didn't like to move. But one day it decided it wanted to glow.

So it looked around and saw some fireflies. They were glowing! The rock wanted to glow just like them.

The rock was stubborn and didn't want to move any closer to them. But suddenly the fireflies flew right over and landed on the rock.

The fireflies made the rock glow brighter than ever before! It was so happy. The rock shined so brightly that even the sun said "Wow!"

The rock kept glowing, and from then on, the rock always looked to the fireflies for its light.

Once upon a time, there was a little girl named Sara. She was only three years old, and she was always excited to try new things.

One day, her mommy said, "We're going to try something new today, Sara." She took Sara to a special tutor.

The tutor asked, "Do you want to pretend?" Sara nodded her head, yes.

The tutor said, "Let's pretend to be animals."

Sara thought that was an unusual and fun idea. She pretended to be a lion and the tutor pretended to be a moose. They pretended to run around and Sara growled like a real lion.

At the end of the session, Sara hugged her tutor and said goodbye. She was so happy to have tried something new and unusual.

Billy was so excited - today he was going to learn how to read! He had a big book with pictures that were bright and colourful. He looked at them and knew he was going to love it. His teacher said he was a very fair reader and that made him feel proud. 

After reading, he had a shower. He loved the feeling of the warm water running down his body, and the soap bubbles smelling so nice. It was the perfect way to end the day. 

When Billy was in the shower, he thought about the book and what he had learnt. He was sure he had learnt lots of new words and was looking forward to reading them all over again. 

Billy finished his shower and dried himself off. He couldn't wait to get back to the book and read some more. His teacher had said that he was a very fair reader, and Billy was determined to prove it!

Once upon a time there was a little girl named Lucy. She loved to hide. One day, she wanted to find a new place to hide. She looked around her house and found an unknown place. 
It was a corner of her kitchen filled with jam. Everywhere she looked there was jam! She giggled and moved some of the jars aside. She crawled in and hid behind the jam jars.

Lucy started to sing her favorite song as she looked around. Nothing in the corner was familiar. She found something that looked like a button in the corner. She touched it and a panel opened up!

Inside, there was even more jam! Lucy couldn't believe how much jam she found. There were also some toys she had never seen before. She was so excited! She kept playing and having fun until her mom called her for dinner. 

When Lucy was finished eating, she went back to the corner and began to hide again. She played for hours, until finally it was time to go to bed. As she said goodnight and hugged her mom, she secretly smiled as she thought of her unknown hiding spot filled with jam.

Mom was making dinner in the kitchen. She took a sharp knife and cut the potatoes. Mom said, "I'm making dinner, so be careful and stay safe."

Dad was watching the little girl and he said, "Come on sweetheart, let's play with your toys in the living room." The little girl said, "Ok Daddy. Let's go!"

Meanwhile, mom was finished cutting the potatoes. She used the knife to cut the carrots and the onions too. When she was done, she cleaned the knife and put it away in the kitchen.

The little girl was playing with her toys. She had many dolls and building blocks. She was safe and happy with her dad. 

Mom finished making dinner, and the family enjoyed a delicious meal together. They were thankful for all the food!

Once upon a time there was a mister. He was very independent and strong. He didn't need help from anyone. He was able to support himself.

One day, while he was walking along the river, he saw a lot of mist. It looked like a cloud but it was lower to the ground. He was curious so he got closer to it.

Inside the mist, he saw a lot of animals enjoying themselves. It made him really happy. He wanted to help them, so he decided to support them.

He started to give the animals food and water. He made sure they were always safe and secure. He was proud to be able to support them.

And from then on, he always supported them whenever he could. That made them very happy and they thanked him for being so independent.

Once upon a time, there was the bravest boy. He was curious and wanted to explore the world. He loved to go surfing.

One day, he was out on the ocean when his surfboard broke. He was sad. He thought he would never be able to go back in the water. 

Just then, he saw a helpful and kind man. He said to the boy, "I can help repair your surfboard." The happy boy thanked the man and soon his surfboard was as good as new.

The brave boy was so thankful for all the help. He couldn't wait to get back in the water and continue exploring. 

He paddled out into the ocean and enjoyed surfing the waves. He felt great knowing his surfboard was repaired.

Once there was a cool battery. It was his birthday and he sat on the shelf, waiting for the surprise. But he couldn't see what was happening.

He could hear some sounds outside. His curiosity made him peek out of the shelf.

He saw a lot of little friends, all playing around. They were singing and shouting and dancing. He wanted to join them.

He started to bounce up and down, but then he remembered he was stuck on the shelf. So he just peered out, watching the fun.

Suddenly, a huge box appeared! He was so excited! He wanted to know what was inside, but he couldn't get his peepers to see.

Then he remembered something very important - he had an onâ€Š/â€Šoff switch! He switched it on and peered inside the box.

And there it was - a big cake with lots of colour and sparkles. All the little friends were singing "Happy Birthday" to him!

He was so happy that he tried to bounce again, but he realised he was still stuck on the shelf. Well at least he could peek out and make sure that everyone was having fun!

Once upon a time there was a lucky little girl. She was out in the sunshine one day, looking around and observing all the things around her. She wasn't sure what to do, so she sat down and looked at the sky.

The sky was a very round shape and the girl thought it was so fascinating. She watched it for a long time. She saw a big round white cloud in the sky and her eyes opened wide with wonder! 

She jumped up and tried to reach for it. But it was too high for her to grab. She tried and tried but just couldn't reach it.

All of a sudden, the little girl felt something brush against her head. She looked up and saw that the round white cloud had come closer to the ground. It was so lucky! 

The cloud gently floated around her, like it was her friend. She giggled and jumped and ran around, feeling very happy. Finally, she hugged the cloud goodbye before it floated away back into the sky.

Once there was a lively little girl who loved to play. She liked to go outside and explore in the sunshine.

One day when she stepped outside she saw a beautiful flower. She wanted to get a closer look so she knelt down beside it.

Just then, a big gust of wind came and blew it away! The little girl chased after it, but the flower was too fast.

Suddenly, she felt something soft lightly touch her arm. She looked up and found a puppy with a big smile on its face. The puppy had brought her the flower!

The little girl was so pleased. She gave it a big hug and thanked the puppy with a cuddle. From then on they were the best of friends.

One day, Sally was playing in the garden with a toy car. She had found the car by the side of the road. Suddenly, her mum called her inside and told her to put on her apron. 

Sally went inside wearing her apron and saw her mum was really sad. Sally asked mum why she was so sad. Mum said she had lost her favourite apron, the one which grandpa had lent her.

Sally was so sad for her mum, but then she remembered the apron she was wearing. She told her mum that grandpa had lent her this apron. Grandpa had found it by the side of the road and wanted her to have it.

Mum was so happy and she hugged Sally tight. Grandpa had found something special for them and had helped them again. Sally smiled, happy that she could make her mum feel better.

Once upon a time, there were two best friends, Ann and Will. They were both honest people who cared a lot about each other.

One day, Ann gave Will a present. Will was so happy and he waved his hands in the air to say thank you! Ann was happy to see him so happy and waved back to him.

They smiled and had a happy hug. They both felt so lucky to have each other as honest friends.

The end.

Mum showed Billy a razor. He was so happy! He wanted to touch it and play with it, but Mum said no. Instead, she showed him how to use the razor.

Mum made a funny face and said, â€œBe careful. Itâ€™s sharp!â€ Billy was very careful. He lightly touched the razor and made it move back and forth.

Later, Mum told him a story about a rabbit who used the razor to make cool things. Billy was so excited to have his own razor and he couldnâ€™t wait to make his own cool things.

He thanked Mum and hugged her. He was so happy that she showed him how to use the razor.

Bob loves to go on adventures. He went for a walk along the beach, looking for fun and exciting things. All of a sudden, he saw a huge castle with lots of interesting things. Bob was so excited! He ran up to the castle to take a closer look.

The castle was full of organized activities and games. Bob had so much fun playing and exploring! He found all kinds of treasures, like giant shells and colorful rocks. After a few hours, it was time to go home, but Bob was sad. He wished he could stay a little bit longer.

But Bob knew he would come back one day and explore the castle again. He said goodbye and promised to return soon. Bob went home, already thinking of all the fun he would have the next time he came back!

Once upon a time there was a thin man who sailed out of his harbor on a big boat. The man sailed far away, looking for adventure. But the man didn't find any treasure on his journey. Instead, he found something even better - a big twist! The twist was so bright that it lit up the night sky like sunshine. The man was so happy! He followed the twist to the shore where it vanished. The man was amazed - he had a treasure that no one else had ever seen before. He decided to take the twist back home to his harbor and make it part of his home forever. And they all lived happily ever after. The end!

One day, a little boy was ready to march. He was so excited, he couldn't wait to go outside and explore. He put on his shoes and grabbed his warm coat. He said goodbye to his mom and marched right out the door. 

The little boy marched down the street and around the corner. He arrived at a special place with lots of grass, trees, and flowers. He sat down and looked around. A butterfly flew over his head and he smiled. 

Then the little boy got an idea. He marched back to his house and gathered some blankets. He put the blankets in his crib and made a thick, cozy bed. He happily lay down and closed his eyes.

The little boy had a good rest and was ready to march again. He said goodbye to his crib and marched away. He was excited to explore even more of the world around him.

Once upon a time, there was a persistent little girl who wanted to learn how to ride a bike. She had a shiny new bike with pedals. Every day, she would take it out and try to pedal. It was hard at first, but she kept at it. Every day she would try to pedal a little bit farther.

Finally, the day came when she managed to stay on the bike, balance and keep pedaling. She was so excited! She kept pedaling and pedaling until she had finished riding around the block. She was so proud of herself for being so persistent.

The little girl finished her ride with a big smile on her face. She had accomplished her goal! From then on, she rode her bike every day, feeling so proud of herself for being so persistent and never giving up.

Once there was a man. He liked modern things. He decided to ignore a little girl. She wanted to play with him, but he ignored her.

The little girl felt sad. She wanted the man to play with her, but he didn't seem to listen. She tried to say hello and wave at him, but he just looked away.

The little girl didn't give up. She continued to follow the man and smile. She even made a funny face at him. She wanted the man to pay attention to her and be her friend.

Her persistence paid off. The man finally smiled back at the little girl and said hello. The little girl was so happy and she ran to the man. They played together and laughed. The little girl felt glad that the man chose to ignore her and became her friend.

Once upon a time there was a nice house. Inside the house lived a family of five. There were two big people, two small people and a baby.

One day the baby was playing near a big box. When the baby opened the box she revealed a surprise. What was inside? It was a yummy chocolate cake! The baby was so excited and started to laugh and jump.

The two big people were surprised by the discovery and soon the whole house smelled like a yummy cake. It was so delicious! The two small people were very happy and smiled. The family all ate some of the yummy cake and it was gone soon.

The family was very happy and enjoyed the special surprise the baby had revealed.

John was three years old and he loved playing on the lawn. Every day he would spend hours making up games and playing with all of his toys. One day, it started to rain and John moved inside. But then something very strange caught his eye. He saw something strike the lawn! He had never seen anything like it before, it was totally unknown to him. He ran outside to take a closer look and saw the most amazing thing. It was some kind of creature, with green wings and a long tail. John was so excited and he spent the entire afternoon watching the mysterious creature strike around the lawn. Eventually, it flew away and he never saw it again. But John never forgot the experience and every time he visited his lawn, he was always looking for the unknown creature to return.

Once upon a time, a little boy called Jack was playing in his garden. He heard some birds chirping in the trees. He was about to go and take a closer look when his mum called him. She shouted, "Jack! Come and get a seat for dinner."

Jack ran into the house and sat on a seat at the table. But he didn't like it very much because he was upset. He looked around the table at all his family - his mum, his dad and his two brothers - while they were all talking and laughing. But Jack was too upset to say anything. 

In the end, his mum noticed Jack was upset. She asked him what was wrong and he told her that he was sad because he hadn't seen the birds in the trees. His mum smiled and said, "Don't worry - after dinner, let's go out and look for the birds together."

Jack smiled back and said, "OK!" His mood changed instantly and he started laughing and talking with his family. They finished their dinner and then went outside to look for the birds. 

And they lived happily ever after. The End!

Once upon a time, there lived a mighty bear. He lived deep in the forest, away from any humans and other creatures. One day he was feeling very sad. He tried to play his favorite game, but he just couldn't. He started to weep, his big, hairy tears dropping to the forest floor.

Soon, a tiny mouse came around the corner. The mouse saw the bear crying and knew that he was sad. The mouse wanted to make the mighty bear feel better, so he scurried around the forest to find a surprise for him. Eventually, he found an amazing game that he knew the bear would love.

The mouse ran back to the bear with the game. The bear was very thankful and he finally stopped weeping. He thanked the tiny mouse, and immediately started to play the game. Suddenly, the bear felt happy and mighty again!

Once there was a boy named Jamie. He was very ordinary. He wanted to be different, so he decided to pay a visit to the harbor. 

When he arrived, Jamie saw lots of boats and birds. He was so excited! He paid a man some money, and the man gave him a boat. Then he sailed away.

Jamie sailed over the waves. He watched the birds and the other boats around him. He was so happy! He sailed for a long time, until it was time to go home. 

When Jamie arrived at the harbor, the man told him he had to pay for the boat. Jamie was so disappointed. He didn't have enough money to pay for it. 

But then a kind person stepped up and offered to pay. Jamie was so happy! He thanked the person and said goodbye. Then he went home, feeling very ordinary but grateful.

Once upon a time, there was a man and a lady who liked each other very much. They wanted to be together forever, so they decided to marry. 

On the day of their wedding, the lady brought a drum. She said it was a present for the man. It was the most brilliant drum that anyone had ever seen! It shone in a bright yellow colour and had a beautiful pattern on it. 

The man and the lady were so happy that they hugged and kissed each other. Then the man played a song on the drum. It was the best song anyone had ever heard. 

They danced together to the song and laughed and smiled so much that it made everyone else happy too. 

The man and the lady had a brilliant day when they married. They were together forever, and it was all thanks to the wonderful drum!

Once upon a time, there was a perfect valley. Every morning, the birds flew in and perched in the trees and sang sweetly. At night, the sky filled with stars. All the animals lived in the valley and were happy!

One day, a little girl came to explore the valley. She loved it so much that she wanted to record her visit. She went around the valley, taking pictures of all the animals, plants, and streams.

When she was done, the little girl looked up at the sky and saw a perfect rainbow. She couldn't believe she was so lucky to see it. She ran back to her camera and clicked a picture, recording it forever. 

The little girl was so proud of capturing the beauty of the valley. She knew her family would be proud of her too. From that day on, she came back to the valley to visit every chance she got!

Once upon a time, there was a girl who had a special suit. Every day, she would lift it up and put it on her body.

One day, the girl was excited to go to the beach. She put on her special suit and was ready to have fun in the sun. But when she arrived at the beach, she noticed that the water was sour. It tasted yucky!

The girl wanted to go for a swim, but she was too scared to get in the water. Then, she had a solution! She took her special suit off and held it in her hands. She was careful not to get it wet in the sour water.

The girl lifted up the suit and ran around the beach. She swished it through the air and used it to fly around like a kite. She had so much fun!

When she was done playing, she put her special suit back on and walked away with a smile. She vowed to always remember her special suit and never forget to lift it up and have fun.

Once upon a time, there was a clumsy girl called Maddie. She loved playing in her bedroom and exploring all the places she could find. One day, she noticed a big drawer at the bottom of her wardrobe. It was exciting and she wanted to see inside, so she carefully pulled it open.

Maddie found lots of old toys inside the drawer. She pulled one out and started to play with it. But oh no! Maddie was so clumsy, she moved too quickly and the drawer toppled over. Suddenly all the toys came tumbling out!

Maddie quickly started to put the toys back in the drawer. She carefully removed a stuffed lion and put it in the drawer. Then she put away a hot pink doll. She put the toys back and closed the drawer with a bang.

When it was all done, Maddie stepped back and looked at the drawer. She was so happy that she had worked it all out. No one would ever know that Maddie had been so clumsy!

It was a sunny day in the park, and Jeff was there with his dad. He saw a rat with a bald head and he was so excited. He ran over to the rat to say hello, but the rat vanished! Jeff was so sad and started to cry.

Dad comforted Jeff and said, "Don't cry, Jeff, the rat will come back". He told Jeff that all things vanish and then come back, like the moon. He said it was like a game, and he pointed to the sky and showed Jeff how the moon vanishes during the day and then comes back at night.

Jeff liked this game and smiled again. They both looked up and saw the moon in the sky, starting to vanish little by little. They couldn't wait for the night when it would come back.

There was a big backyard. It was nice and dry. In the backyard there was a boy. His name was John and he was three years old.

John was playing in the backyard. He ran around and played with the toys. He had a big smile on his face. He knew there were many things to do in the backyard.

John was exploring the backyard when he saw something interesting. He saw a small squirrel! The squirrel was looking around too. It was so cute. John didn't know what to do.

John was brave and stepped closer to the squirrel. The squirrel hopped away, but John followed it. He wanted to get to know the squirrel better.

Suddenly, the squirrel stopped and turned to look at John. It was as if it wanted to be friends! John was so happy. From then on, they were always playing together in the backyard. John knew he was lucky to have a friend like the squirrel.

Once there was a little girl. She was very happy, but she was also very pale.

One day she decided to go on an adventure. She put on her hat and left the house.

She walked for a while and then she saw something. It was a tree with a big green yogurt on top of it! She jumped up to get it but it was too high. 

She started to cry, but then another person came and gave her the yogurt. She was so happy and thanked the person.

She took a big bite out of the yogurt and then she said goodbye and left. 

She was never so happy to be on an adventure before. She walked home with a big smile on her face and a pale yogurt in her hand.

Once there was a regular little boy. He was three-years-old, and loved to eat pie. One day he saw that his dad had made a special pie. It was just for him. His dad said, â€œWhen you eat this pie, it will help you rise.â€ 

So the little boy ate the pie. He ate every bite, until it was all gone. The little boy felt different after he ate the pie. He felt strong and full of energy. He wanted to try something new. 

He wanted to rise. He climbed up onto a chair and then up onto a table. He balanced on one foot and barely wobbled. He smiled and laughed as he raised his hands in the air. He looked around and marveled at his accomplishment.

The little boy was so happy that he had risen. He had shown his dad that he was brave and strong. He hugged his dad and said thank you for the pie. His father said, â€œYou are very welcome. Iâ€™m glad that the pie gave you the strength to rise.â€

Once upon a time there were two friends, a bear and a frog. They both loved the outdoors. When it was warm, they liked to go for walks in the woods and play in the sunshine.

As time passed, the temperatures got cooler and the days became shorter. The bear and the frog knew that the season was changing. They knew that the leaves on the trees would start to fall and become crunchy.

The bear and the frog started to talk about their favorite season. The bear said winter was his favorite because he could build snowmen and go sledding. The frog thought summer was his favorite because he loved to swim in the pond and explore the garden.

The friends had a funny argument about which season was the best. Finally, they decided that every season had something fun to offer and they both agreed that exploring outside was always a good time!

Once upon a time, a cop was walking down the street. He was famous for being the best cop in the town. As he was walking, he saw a sack on the ground. He was curious, so he went to take a closer look. When the cop opened the sack, he found lots of toys and sweets inside. At first, he was very surprised. Then, he had an idea. He decided to take the sack of toys and sweets to a nearby park, where some children were playing. When the kids saw the cop, they were very excited. They asked what was in the sack, and the cop said it was a present for them. The kids couldn't believe it! They thanked the cop and thought he was very kind. They opened the sack, and their faces lit up with joy. They took out all the toys and sweets and shared them with each other. After all the kids had fun, they thanked the cop again. From that day on, the cop became even more famous in the town.

Once upon a time there was a gifted girl named Jessie. She liked to sing and was very good at it. One day, Jessie had a strange urge to go to the opera. She'd never been to an opera before, but felt a pull to go and sing. 

When Jessie arrived, she saw a big building with lots of people going inside. She asked if she could come in too and they let her! Jessie was so excited. When she went into the theatre she saw something even more special. Everyone was singing and the music was so beautiful! Jessie found herself singing along and the sounds of her voice filled the entire theatre.

The crowd was in awe and the conductor asked her to come up to the stage. Jessie was scared, but felt another urge inside her, so she walked up to the stage. When she started to sing, everyone listened in amazment. Jessie's voice was like an angel! Everyone was so impressed and Jessie smiled proudly. 

Jessie had followed the urge to come to the opera and it made her special talent shine!

Once upon a time, there was a rich man who lived in a big house. One day, the rich man saw rain falling outside. He thought it was so special, so he decided to display it for the world to see. 

The rich man opened his windows and made a large canvas. He took the rain from outside and put it carefully on the canvas. Then he hung it up, so everybody could see all the beautiful colors. 

When the people in the town saw the rich man's rain display, they were all very amazed. They could not believe such beauty existed. 

From that day forward, the rich man displayed the rain every day. The colors sparked joy in the hearts of everyone who saw it. 

The end.

Alex and his mom were in the park one warm summer day. Alex had brought his camera so he could take lots of photos of the happy animals. He saw a cute chipmunk eating a spicy nut and quickly took a picture.

Mom and Alex then moved over to the wide river that ran through the park. Suddenly, a family of ducks appeared along the bank. Even though the ducks were far apart from each other, Alex wanted to take a photo of all of them together. He lined up the ducks and took the photo.

Alex looked closely at the photo and noticed that the ducks were far apart from each other in the picture. Alex's mom smiled at him and said, "Sometimes things need to be separate in order to be seen." Alex smiled back at her and put the photo in his pocket.

Bob was a human. He had one unusual thing he liked to do. He liked to throw things! But he wasn't throwing just any kinds of things. He threw his food and sometimes his toys. No one thought it was a good idea, but he loved it.

One day, he threw his banana up into the air. It was his best throw ever! But, when the banana came back down, it bumped into a bird. The bird flew away and then Bob felt bad. He wished he never threw his food.

From then on, Bob decided to not throw his food anymore. He only threw his toys and he was careful not to bother any animals. He still loved throwing things and his friends thought it was fun and unusual.

Bob's friends made a game and they would compete with each other to see who could make the best throws. Bob was the best thrower and he never stopped being unusual. Even though it wasn't always the best thing, Bob loved to throw.

Once there was a little girl named Lucy. She was very stubborn and wanted to explore everything. One day she decided to march away from home. She was wearing her favourite red dress, and carrying her favourite teddy bear.

Lucy marched for a long time and came across a hut. It was made from old wood and had a big door. She was curious and wanted to see what was inside. She tried to open the door, but it wouldn't budge.

Lucy got more and more stubborn and kept trying to open the door, until finally it opened a little bit. She peeked inside, but it was too dark for her to see.

So Lucy marched away, and went exploring in the woods. From then on she always passed by the old hut, but she never stopped to look inside again.

Once upon a time there was a little boy called Mark. He loved going for walks outside and collecting things. One day, Mark went for a walk and found a twig. He picked it up and thought it was very special. He held it tight and decided to take it home. 

On his way back, Mark saw a squirrel. It was very angry and scurried around looking for something. Mark forgot about his twig for a moment and wondered why the squirrel was so angry. Then he remembered his twig and quickly put it in his pocket. 

When Mark got home, he took the twig out of his pocket and marveled at how special it was. He smiled and was happy to have it. He kept it safely at home, never to forget how much he liked it!

The day was hot. I could see the sun high in the sky and feel its warmth. I was excited because my family was having a party. I noticed lots of people outside. All of them were talking, eating and drinking. 

I ran around, enjoying the day. Everywhere I looked, I saw people laughing and smiling. Some of them hugged me and gave me candy. It was so nice.

I started to get tired, so I sat down and observed the party carefully. I saw lots of adults chatting and eating. I also saw some kids like me, playing and running around. Everyone was having a good time.

Suddenly, I heard someone calling my name. It was my mom asking me to come inside for dinner. I said goodbye to all my friends and followed her. As I looked back, I smiled. The party was so much fun.

Once upon a time, there was a girl who was three years old. She was very happy and loved to play. She had a special drawer that was full of her toys. One day, something special happened. When she opened the drawer, she saw something red inside! She was so excited because she had never seen a red toy before. She picked it up and played with it all day. She liked it so much, she never wanted to put it away! The girl was so happy that she had a new toy to play with. The end.

Mummy and Daddy went to the store. They had lots of shopping to do. They bought a big box of food to keep them safe and healthy. They also bought some news.

Mummy and Daddy took the news home. They opened the news and shared it with each other. They were very happy and excited.

Mummy and Daddy took the food out of the big box and put it in the kitchen. They cooked some yummy food for dinner.

After dinner, Mummy and Daddy enjoyed a sweet treat and read the news from the store. They were very happy and had a nice evening together.

Once upon a time there was a young man who wanted to perform words. So, he searched far and wide for the right words to perform. He found some beautiful words that sounded amazing. He practiced each word before he was ready to perform them.

On the day of the big performance, the young man was nervous but excited. When he walked out onto the stage, he started to shake. But he searched inside himself and found the courage to perform the words.

The words came out beautifully and the audience cheered. The young man was so proud of himself for performing the words. Everyone was very impressed with his performance.

He went home that day feeling happy and proud. He knew he would always remember his special performance.
